with, or vnder any of the seales abouesaid, to any body politique, or corporate, or to any other person, or persones of any Honours, castelles manours, landes, tenementes, rents, reuercions, seruices, personages, tithes, pencions, porcions, aduowsons, nominaciōs, presentaciōs, fraūchises, liberties, and other hereditamentes, commodities, possessions, & profeictes, of what kinde, nature, or qualitye soeuer they, or any of thē be, is, or shalbe, or by whatsoeuer name or names they or any of them, be, is, or shalbe named, knowen, or reputed, shall stand & bee taken, reputed & iudged good, sure, perfeict, effectual, & auailable in the law, during ye statutes in them limitted & specified, to al intents, respectes, constructions & purposes against the king his heires, & successors without any confirmacion, lycence, dispensacion, or toleracion of the kynge, hys heires or successours: any the causes or matters aboue mencioned, conteined, or hereafter during his said highnes life to be conteined, had, or made in any such letters Patentes, indentures, or other writyngs by ye kyng our Soueraigne lord, to ye contrary in any wise notwithstandīg.

Prouided alway, that this act, ne any thing therin cōteined, shal not in any wise extende to reuiue, or make good any letters patents made of any office, or offices to any comptroller, customer, alneger, or sercher ne to any letters patentes of the graunte of any other office, or offyces heretofore graunted, or made by our saide Soueraigne lorde the king which now is, or be, or at any time heretofore haue bene adnichelated, determined, or made voide by iugement, by aucthoritie of parlyament or decree, nor to any patēt to be made to any person or persōs for terme of yeres, or during the minoritie of an heire, of, or in any manours, lāds or tenements, wherof any trauerse hereafter shalbe tēdred within thre monethes after any office founde and certified into anye of the kynges courtes of record, ne to any leasses, or grauntes of any manors, lands, or tenementes of our saide Soueraigne Lordes hereafter to bee made vnder anye of the Seales of the courts aforesayde, cōtrary to the limytacyon, ordinaunce, prouision, establishment and aucthority of the same courts, any thyng in this act conteined to the contrary notwtstanding.

Prouided also, and be it enacted, that this act, nor any thing therein conteined shal not extende to make any letters patentes of any offyce, or offyces, to be of any other effect, force, or strēgth, thē the same letters patents were, or should haue bene before the making of this act.

Prouided alway, and be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaid, that al and singuler suche patentes, grauntees, donees, as any time hereafter during the life of our said soueraigne Lord (whiche almighty God long preserue) shal fortune to haue, or obteine any Castelles, manours, landes, tenementes, tithes pencions, porcions, or other hereditaments of the gifte, graunt, sale, or exchange of the kynges Maiestye, or of the onely gifte of the kinges Maiestie, of his most lyberal dysposycion, and not solde, whiche at the day of the date of the letters Patents therof
made, shalbe of more, or better yerely value to the king in yerelye rente and ferme, then shalbe conteined, mencioned, and specified in any suche letters patentes, and particulers thereof made by the particuler Surueyour, or Surueiours thereof, & in such byll or billes, as shalbe signed and sealed with the hand, or hands of the patentee, or patentees therof to be exhibyted to the kings Maiestye, or his officer or offycers, wythin whose suruey the said manours, landes, and tenementes, and other the premisses, or any parte therof shalbe, or within any of them, whiche bill shalbe signed, sealed, had, and made, as is aforesaide, before any bil shalbe therof signed by the kyngs Maiestie, that then euery of the said patentees, grauntees, and donees, their heires, executours, and admynistratours within one yeare next after due proufe, and decrees therof made and had in the courte, within whose surueye the same castelles, manours, landes, tenementes, & other the premisses, or any parcel therof, before the said gifts and grauntes were, shal content and pay to the king for the same ouerplus, & more value of the same manours, lands, tenementes, tithes, pencions, portions, & other hereditamentes to hym solde, or exchaunged, after such rate, as other landes, and tenementes were before to him sold or exchaunged, and for the ouerplus and more value of suche landes and tenementes as shal happen to be geuen by ye kings Maiesty, and not solde, as is abouesaid, the saide patentee, hys heirs, executours, or administratours shal content and pay to the king after the rate of twenty yeres purchase, so that the same proufe and decree be had, & made in maner & fourme abouesaid, within .x. yeres next after the date of the saide letters patentes.

div.head: ¶ The .ix. Chapiter. ¶ An Acte for the vniting of certein churches within the city of Yorke.
div.p:
WHere in the auncyent citie of Yorke and suburbes of the same there are manye parishe churches, whiche heretofore the same beyng well inhabited and replenished with people, were good and honest liuinges for learned Incumbents, by reason of the pryuie tythes of the ryche marchauntes, and of the offrings of a great multitude, whyche liuinges is nowe so muche decaied by the ruin and decaye of the saide citye, and of the trade of marchaundyse there, that the reuenues and profites of diuers of the same benefyces are at thys present not aboue the clere yerely value of .xxvi.s̄. viii.d. so that a great sort of them are not a compentent and honest liuing for a good curate: yea, and no persone will take the cure, but that of necessitye there is some chaunterie Priest, or elles some late Relygious persone beyng a stypendarie taken and appointed to the saide cure and benefyce, which for the moste parte are vnlearned, and verye ignoraunt personnes, not able to doe anye parte of their duties: By reason whereof the saide citie is not onely replenished with blinde guides and Pastours, but also
the people muche kept in ignoraunce, aswell of their duties towardes God, as also towardes the kinges Maiestie, and the common wealthe of this realme, and to the great daunger of their soules: In consideraciō wherof, and for the better relief and order of the saide citie, it maye please the kinges maiesty by thassent of the lordes spirituall & tēporall and the commons in this present parliament assēbled, & by thaucthoryritie of the same, that from henceforth it shalbe lawfull to the Maior, & Recorder of the saide citie, & the ordinary or his deputie, & vi. Iustices of peace in the said citie, to vnyte & knit together the said parishes into fewer number, that is to wete, so many of the said parishes into one parish, as to them shalbe thought conuenient to be a liuing for one honest incumbent, so the cleare yerely value of one parishe excede not .xx. li. by yere, and so to procede through the saide citie and suburbs of the same. And that it shalbe lefull for the saide Maior, Recorder, and Aldermen, to pull downe the churches, whiche they shal think superfluous in thesaid citie and suburbes of the same, and to bestowe the same toward ye reparacions and enlargement of other churches, of the bridges in the saide citie, and to the relyefe of the poore people, And further, that the said Maior, Recorder, Ordinarie, or his deputy, & .vi. Iustices of peace being Aldermen, shal allot & appoint the presentment & patronage of ye church so vnited to the patrons of al the churches, to knit in one parish that they may make their presentments by turne, euery one according to their quantitie of his former patronage.

Prouided alwaies and be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaide, ye al such incumbents of the churches aforesayde, that shalbe put downe by vertue of this act, shall haue the yerely value of their benefices after the rate they do pay tenthes during their liues, so they wyll do seruyce therfore in the churches appointed for the parish churche, according to their former duties: And if they refuse to serue, then they onely during their liues to haue the thirde parte of the value as is aforesaid, & to be paied at the hands of the incumbent of ye parish church to be appointed

Prouided also, and be it enacted by thaucthority aforesayd, that the incumbents of euery such church, which by vertue of this acte shallbe made and ordeyned for the parish churche, & whereunto any other parishe, or parishes shalbe vnited, shal after the vnion therof, yerelye pay • the tenthes to be due for the same to the kynges Maiestie, his heires & successours of the same churche, and of al other churches therunto vnited & annexed. And the sayd incumbents of the parishe churche so vnyted to haue his allowance of the incumbents of the churches so vnited therunto, during their seueral liues, according to the rate and porciō of the churches so vnited, as shalbe assigned by the abouesaid persons, hauing aucthoritie by this acte to vnite the same. And the successor & successours of euery such incumbēt of euery such churche, as shall be made the parishe churche, & wherunto any churche or parishe shall bee vnited
by force of thys act, shall pay, or compounde for the first fruites thereof at euery auoidaunce before his induction to the same, according to such yerely value, at such church or churches, as shalbe made a parish church & whereunto any church, or churches, parish, or Parishes shalbe vnited by force of this act, shalbe of, at the time of the vnion therof, and as if it had been of suche like yerely value at ye time of making of ye statute for first fruites and tenthes, and of no greater value: any ordinaunce, statute, or lawe, to the contrary notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .x. Chapiter. ¶ An acte for exigentes & Proclamacions in Wales, & in the Countye Palantine of Chester, & also in the citie of Chester.
div.p: WHere in the high Court of Parliament holden at westmynster the .xxvii. yere of the most prosperous reigne of ye late famous king Henry the eight, by the assent of the Lordes Spirytuall and Temporall, and the commons assembled in the saide high Courte of Parliament: it was enacted and establyshed by aucthoritye of the same Parlyamente, that hys highnesse dominion and princypalytie of Wales, and of manours, landes, tenementes, and other domynyons wythin the sayde domynion and pryncipalitye of Wales should be deuyded into twelue Shyeres, or Counties, that is to saye, the Shieres or counties of Glamorgan, Radnour, Brecknok, Karmerthen, Penbroke, Cardigan, Merionneth, Mongomerie, Flinte, Carnaruan, Anglesie, & Denbigh, in euery of whiche saide counties & shyeres, emongst the officers yerely appointed, it was thē ordayned that there should be distinct and seueral shirifes yearelye, & also where the counties Palantine of Chester, and of the citie of Chester, be auncient and seueral coūties Palantine of thēselues, in al which said counties, the kyngs wryt hath not, nor yet doth not runne: So that the proclamacion awarded vpon any exigent against any persone or persons, in any accion, wherin processe of outlawry dothe lye according to the statute made in the .vi. yere of the reigne of the saide late king, cānot be directed vnto ye shirife or shirifes of any of the saide shires or counties, but vnto the shirife of the countye next adioyning: So that the party dwellyng in any of the said shieres or counties, agaynst whom anye suche exigent and proclamacion shalbe so awarded, shall not, nor cā haue any knowledge of the same sure, or processe, by reason wherof many of the persōs inhabitinge in the saide shieres and counties, without knowledge, or cause of suite, haue ben wrōgfully and vniustly vtlaged to their vtter vndoing.

Be it therfore, & for diuerse other good consideracions, by the king our souereigne Lord, with the assent of the Lordes Spirituall & tēporall, and the commons in this present Parliamente assembled, & by the aucthoritie of the same enacted, ordeyned, and establyshed, that if and whē soeuer any writ of exigent at any time after the first daye of April next comming shalbe awarded at the suite of the king, or of any other persō
or persones plaintife, or plaintifes, in any accion or suite, in anye of the courtes of our saide Soueraigne lord the king, his heires or successors commonly called the kinges benche, and the common place, againste any person, or persons, dwelling in any of the aforesaide counties in wales, or in the said counties Palantine of Chester, or the city of Chester, or in any of them: that then immediatly vpon the awarding of euerye such exigent, the Iustice or Iustices before whom any such wryt of exigent vpon such suite, or action shalbe sued, shal haue full & aucthoritye to awarde one writ of proclamacion according to the tenour & effect of Proclamacions awarded vpon exigentes, directed out of any of the saide courtes in London, against any persone dwellinge in anye other shiere, where the kynges writ is curraunt, according to the order and fourme of the sayde statute made in the .vi. yere of the said late king to be directed to such of the aforesaid shirifes of any of the aforesayd coūties in wales, & of the counties Palantine of Chester, and of the city of Chester for the time being, where it shall happen the said defendant, against whom any such action shalbe sued, as is aforesaid, to be dwellīg And that euery such writ of Proclamation shal haue the same teste and day of returne, as thexigents, wherupon euery such writ of Proclamacion shalbe awarded, shal haue: And that euery suche shiryfe to whom any such writ of Proclamaciō shalbe directed, shal make Proclamacyō of the said writ of proclamacion, according to the tenour of the same, & & shal make true returne of the same in such court, & before such iustices as the tenour of the same writ shal require & demaund. And yt al outlaries hereafter to be promulged, or pronounced against anye persone or persons vpon any such exigent, or exigents, awarded against any persō or persons, dwelling in any of the said counties of wales, & the coūties Palantine of Chester, & of the citie of Chester, & no writ of Proclamacion awarded in fourme abousaid, to the shyrife, or shirifes of the countie, where the party defendaūt shalbe, as is abouesaid, dwelling, or not returned, to be clerely voide, and of none effecte, nor force in the lawe.

And be it further enacted by the aucthority aforesaid, that al & euery shierife and shierifes of euery of the said counties of Wales, and of the counties Palantine of Chester, and of the cytye of Chester aforesayde shall haue in euery of the saide courtes of the kynges Benche, & of the common place, one sufficient Deputie at the least, to receiue all wrytts directed to suche the shiryfe, or shierifes, for whom the same Deputie or deputies shalbe appointed, in like maner, and fourme, and vpon like peines, as by the former statutes & lawes of this realme other shirifes of other shires, or counties within this realme of Englande be boūden to haue, in either of the same courtes: and that all writtes of proclamacion aforesaide shalbe deliuered vnto euery suche Deputy of Recorde in the same courtes, and also like fees shalbee payde for making euerye suche writ of proclamacion, and for enrolling the same of Recorde, as is
limitted in the said statute made in the said sixt yere of the reigne of our said late Souereigne lord king Henry the eight.

And be it further enacted by the aucthority aforesaid, that if any person dwellyng in any of the saide counties of Wales, after the aforesaid first day of April, shalbe outlawed in any suite, or action aforesaid, that then writs of special Capias vtlagaf; single Capias vtlagat{ur}, nō molestand' and all other processe, for, or against any persone outlawed, shal, & may frō thenceforth be directed to the sherief of any of the saide counties in Wales, as immediate officers to the kings said courtes of the kynges benche, or common place in that behalfe: and that euery suche writtes may be deliuered of recorde to the deputie of suche of the saide sherifes, to whom any suche writ, or processe shalbe directed, & that euerye suche shirife shal make execucion and returne of euery suche writte of processe to him directed, vpon like peyne & penaltie, as is aboue limytted.

And be it further enacted & established, that if any such writ, or writtes of Proclamacion hereafter directed to any of the shirifes of anye of the saide shieres in Wales, or counties Palantyne of Chester, or of the citie of Chester, be deliuered vnto any of the saide sherifes for the tyme being, or to his or their deputy, in maner & forme aforesaid: & the same sherife or sherifes do not make true returne of euery suche writ & writtes of Proclamacion, into such courte & courtes, out of which the saide writ, or writtes of Proclamacion shalbe awarded: that for euery such faulte of none returne, euerye suche sherife for the time being shall lose and forfait .v. li. the one halfe thereof shalbe to our Soueraigne Lord the king, his heires and successours: the other halfe to any such persone or persons as wil sue for the same in an accion of debt grounded vpon this acte, in any of the kinges courtes of recorde, wherein no essoygne, proteccion, or wager of lawe shalbe allowed, or admitted.

Prouided alwaies this acte, or any thing therein conteined, shal not in any wise extend, or be preiudicial to the same countyes of Wales, or to ye saide counties Palantine of Chester, or of the citie of Chester, for, or concerning such liberties, franchises, or priuileges, as belong to thē, or any of them, or to any ministers, or officers of them, or anye of them, otherwise, or in any other maner, then by the true meanīg of this act is before prouided & declared: any thing in this act mencioned to the contrary notwithstanding.

Prouided alwaies, and be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaide, yt thys act, ne any thing therin conteined, shal not in any wise be preiudycial, or hurtefull to any Lorde marcher in Wales, but that they & euery of them, and their heires, and the heires of euery of them shal and may haue like liberty, interest, and preeminence, as they, and euerye of them had, might, or ought to haue had before the making of this act, and as though this acte had neuer been had, ne made: anye thyng in this acte mencioned to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ The .xi. Chapiter. An Acte for the repeale of a certaine statute made in the .xxviii. yere of the reigne of the late king of most famous memory Henry the .viii for reuoking of actes of Parliament.
div.p:
WHere in the Parlyament begonne at Westmynster the .xxviii. yere of the reigne of the late Kynge of famous memorye kyng Henry the eight, it was enacted by the aucthoritie of the saide Parliament, that if the Emperyall crowne of this Realme, after the decease of the saide late kyng, shoulde dyscende, come, or remain to the heires of oure said late Soueraign Lord, or to any person to be lymitted by his highnesse, as of verye ryght it must, and ought to doe accordyng to the lawes of this realme established for the same, the said heire, or suche persone beinge within the age of fower & twenty yeres, & that then any acte or actes of Parliament should happen to be made & established in any parliamēt, yt then should be holden before such heire or heires, person or persons then being in possession of the sayd crowne should be of their full ages, of .xxiiii. yeres, that then euery such heire, or heires of our saide late soueraigne Lorde, or such person so possessed of the crowne being within the same age of .xxiiii. yeares, should haue ful power and aucthoritie at all times, after they should come to their said full ages of .xxiiii. yeres, by their letters patentes vnder the great seale of England to reuoke, adnul, & repeale all and singuler such acts made & established by their royal assentes, in any Parliament holden during ye time that they were within their said age of .xxiiii. yeares, their roiall assentes had to the same, during the time that they were within ye said age of .xxiiii. yeres or any acte, or actes therafter to be made, to the contrary therof notwithstāding. And it was also enacted by the auctority aforesaide, that euery suche repeale, adnullacion, and reuocacion of any acte or actes that should be made and established, in any Parliamente holdē before the time that such heirs, or person possessed of the crowne should be of the said age of xxiiii. yeres should be as good and effectual, to all intents & purposes, as though it hath ben done by the aucthority of Parliament, as in the saide acte is more plainly declared: Sith the makyng of which estatute, it hath pleased almightie GOD to take vnto his mercye our saide late Soueraigne Lorde king Henry the eight, our now most gracious & deare Soueraigne liege lord kyng Edward the .vi. his sonne & heire (whose life God lōg preserue) now beīg aboue the age of .x. yeres & vnder the age of .xi. yeres: during whose minority as the common wealth of his highnesse realme of England, & Ireland as of all the dominions and countreis of the same, is, and moste necessarye ought to be prouided for, maintetned, and preserued: so is it the naturall duitie of euery good, true, and louing subiecte, to applie him self with al his power and diligence, to studye, inuente, and practyse by all waies, meanes, and maners, for the conseruacion of the same. And for
asmuche as for the preseruacion of the royal estate of our said souerain Lorde the king that now is, & ye safegard and suerty of hys most royal persone, & for the good tranquilitie, quietnes, rest, and peace of his sayd Realmes, countreis, dominions, and subiectes, aswel wholsome lawes & statuts are to be ordeined, established, & prouided, as also some lawes & statutes to bee repealed & adnulled, as the case shal require, accordīg to the disposicion of the people, whiche cannot take anye good effect, or successe, without actes & prouisions of Parliamente to be made, before their ages of .xxiiii. yeres. And for that it should seme vnto all men, that the good intencion, meaning, & purpose of the said late king, and of the makers of the sayde statute, was not, that good and wholsome lawes which should be made, prouided, and ordained for the good gouernāce of the Realmes and dominions abouesaide, during the time that anye kyng of this Realme should be within ye said age of .xxiiii. yeres shoulde from the time of the decease of the auncestor, or progenitor of any suche king, within the age of .xxiiii. yeres, at the time of the death of the saide auncestour, or progenitour, vntill the age of .xxiiii. yeares, of any suche king, be made, demed, and adiudged to be voide by any such letters patentes, to al intentes & purposes, as though they neuer had been made but that the saide actes, and euery of them, and all, and euery thynge, & thinges vsed, committed, doone, suffered, or executed by aucthority of the same, should be good, auaylable, and perfit in the lawe: And that ye saide reuocacion, adnullacion, & repeale, should be taken to make voide the saide actes, and euery of them onely, from the time of the said reuocation, adnullacion and repeale, & not otherwise: The cōtrary entendement and exposicion wherof, might otherwise, not onely discourage all subiectes during that time, and those yeres, to endeuour themselues, to and for the aduising, setting foorthe, and consenting to the making of good and wholsome lawes: but also shoulde cause the sayd subiects to adiudge and thinke themselues to liue for that time, vnder no manner of certaintie, or assuraunce of any positiue lawe, or statute during that time to be made, or prouided: Be it therefore enacted, by the king oure Souereigne Lorde, with thassent of the Lordes spiritual & temporal, & the commons in this present Parliament assembled, & by the aucthoritie of the same, that the said act of parliament aboue recyted, made in the saide .xxviii. yeare of the reigne of the said late King, & euery word, article, clause, matter, sentence, and thing therein specified & conteined, shall by aucthoritie of this present Parliament, bee, to all intentes, construccions, and purposes, vtterly voide, adnulled, repeled, and of none effect, & as though the same had neuer ben had ne made. Neuertheles to the entente the kinges Maiestie our Souereign lord may haue power; aucthoritie, preeminence and prerogatiue at his full age of .xxiiii yeres, or at any time after, at his libertie and pleasure, to repeale al statutes and actes of Parliament, aswel made in this present parliament
as hereafter in any other Parlament to be holden, before he shall accōplishe the sayde age of xxiiii. yeres, to be made or ordeined, according to the true intent and meaning of the makers of the sayde former statute.

Be it further ordeyned and enacted by the aucthoritie of thys present Parlament, that our saide soueraigne lord the kyng that now is, at hys full age of xxiiii. yeres, or at any tyme after, and all and euerye heire and heires of the sayd late kyng, and other persone and persones, to whom the Emperial crowne of thys realme shal hereafter descend, come, or remaine by thappointment of the sayde late kyng, in that case prouided & made, then being within the age of xxiiii. yeres, shall haue full power & aucthoritie, by vertue of thys present acte, at all tymes, after he, or they shal come to hys, or their full age of xxiiii. yeres, by hys, or theire letters patentes, vnder the great Seale of Englande, to repeale all & singular acte & actes, or any of thē, as be, or shalbe made, or establyshed by hys or theire Royal assentes in any Parlament holden, or to be holden, during the tyme that he, or they was, were, or shalbe, within ye said age of xxiiii. yeres, other then thys present act of Parlament, and other then all pardons graunted & to bee graunted, within the said seueral ages of xxiiii. yeres, by auctoritie of Parlament, so that the same repeale be made and vsed in maner and fourme hereafter folowing, that is to say, that euery suche letters patentes of repeale shall conteine all suche actes, as shalbee repealed, and shalbe solemnely & openly proclaimed in the kyngs courte of Chauncerie, betwene the houres of ix. & xi. before noone at three seuerall dayes, in euery of two of the iiii. vsual termes to bee holden at westminster, or els where withyn thys realme of Englande, & also one time in euery countie of thys Realme, and in wales, at the seueral Assises to bee holden in the same seuerall counties, betwene like houres, and that then after xl. daies next after suche Proclamation, in all and euery place and countie aboue saide, so had and made, the sayde letters patentes of repeale to take their force, strength and effect, and not before, or from any other tyme or season, nor in any other maner or fourme. And that all and euery suche acte and actes, aswel made in thys Parlament, as here after to be made, within the sayde age of xxiiii. yeres, of our souereygne Lord the kynges maiestie that now is, as in the tyme of any of the sayd heire or heires, or other the saide persone or persones then beyng in possession of the Imperial crowne of this realme, & vnder the age of xxiiii. yeres, shalbe good and effectuall to all intentes, constructions, and purposes, vntill the sayde letters Patentes of repeale, Proclamations, and xl. dayes shalbe so had, made, runne, and past: and that all and euery act and actes, thing and thinges, vsed, had, committed, doen, suffred, or executed by the auctoritie of the sayde acte or actes, or anye of them, within any of the sayde ages of xxiiii. yeres, according to the purporte, tenor, & effect of the sayde act or actes, or any of them, shalbe good and offectual for euer, the sayde repeale so to be made, in any wise notwithstanding, &
that all and euery persone and persones, bodies politique and corporat, shall and may by the aucthoritie of thys present acte, from time to time, aswell after the sayde repeale as before, pleade, or allege, for his or their defence, excuse, indemnitie, profite, benefite, or aduantage, all and euery suche act or actes, or any of them so reuoked, adnulled, or repealed, or to bee reuoked, adnulled, or repealed, for, concerninge, or in anye wise touching any thing or thynges had, vsed, graunted, suffered, possessed, committed, doen, or accrued, by thauctoritie, sufferaunce, or force of the sayd acte and actes, or anye of them before the reuocation, adnullation, or repealinge of the same, in suche and as ample maner and fourme, as if the sayd acte and actes so to be reuoked, adnulled, or repealed, and euery of them, had stand in hys and their full strength, force, and effect, and as yf the sayd act or actes had neuer ben reuoked, adnulled, or repealed: anye thyng in suche repeale conteined notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, & be it also ordeyned & enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, that no kyng nor kynges of thys realme, shal haue aucthoritie, power, or prerogatiue, to repeale any acte of Parlament or estatute, that shalbe made in the tyme of anye kyng before the sayde age of xxiiii. yeres, other then such as be, or shalbe made in his owne tyme: any thing aboue mencioned to the contrarye in anye wise notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ An act for the repeale of certain statutes, concerning treasons, felonies, &c. ¶ The .xii. Chapiter.
div.p:
NOthing being more godlye, more sure, more to bee wished & desired betwixt a Prince, the supreme head and ruler, & the subiectes, whose gouernour & head he is, then on the princes parte, great clemencie and indulgencie, and rather to muche forgeuenesse & remission of hys royal power, & iuste punishemēt; then exact seueritie & iustice to be shewed: & on the subiects behalfe that they shoulde obey rather for loue, and for the necessitie and loue of a kyng and Prince, then for feare of hys streight, and seuere lawes: yet suche times at some time commeth in the common wealth, that it is necessary and expedient, for the repressing of the insolencie and vnrulines of men, and for the foreseeing and prouiding of remedies against rebellion, insurrection, or suche mischiefes (as god some tyme with vs displeased for oure punishement doth inflicte and laye vpon vs, or the Deuill at Goddes permission to assaye the good and goddes elect, doth sowe, and sette emonges) the which almyghtie God, with hys helpe and mannes policie, hath alwayes been content and pleased to haue stayed, that sharper lawes, as a harder bryddle should be made, to stay those men & factes, that might els be occasion, cause and aucthours of further inconuenience, the which thing caused the prince of most famous memory, kyng Henry the eight, father to our said soueraigne Lord the kyng, and other hys hyghenes progenitours, with thassent of the nobles & commons, at diuers Parlaments in theire seueral tymes holden, to make and enacte
certain lawes and statutes, which mighte seeme and appeare to men of exterior realmes, & many of the kyngs maiesties subiects very streight, sore, extreme, & terrible, although they wer then, when they were made not without great consideration & pollicie, moued and established, and for the time to thaduoidaunce of further inconuenience, very expedient and necessary. But as in tempest or winter, one course, & garment is cōuenient, in calme or warme wether, a more liberal rase, or lyghter garment, both may, and ought to be folowed and vsed: so we haue seene diuers streight and sore lawes made in one Parlement, the tyme so requiring, in a more calme and quiet reigne of another prince, by the like aucthoritie and Parlament repealed and taken awaye. The whiche moste hyghe clemencie and Royall example of hys Maiesties most noble progenitours, the kyngs hyghenes of hys tender & godly nature most geuē to mercy and loue of his Subiectes, willing to followe, and perceauing the hartie and syncere loue, that hys moste louing Subiectes, both the Lordes & cōmons doth beare vnto hys hyghnesse, now in thys hys maiesties tēder age, willing also to gratifie the same therfore, and minding further to prouoke hys sayde subiectes with indulgencie and clemencie shewed on hys hyghnes behalfe, to more loue and kyndnes toward hys Maiestie (if it may be) and vpon trust that they will not abuse the same, but rather be encoraged thereby more faithfully, & with more diligence (if it may bee) and care for hys Maiestie, to serue hys hyghnesse now in thys hys tender age, is contented and pleased, that ye seueritie of certain lawes here folowing be mitigated & remitted: Be it therfore ordeined and enacted by the kyng our souereigne lord, with thassent of the Lordes spiritual and temporal, and of the cōmons in thys present parlamēt assembled, & by the aucthoritie of the same, that from henceforthe, none acte, deede, or offence, being by acte of Parlament, or statute made treason, or petit treason, by woordes, writing, cyphring, dedes, or otherwise whatsoeuer shalbe taken, had, demed, or adiudged to bee hygh treason, or petit treason, but onely such as be treason or petit treason, in, or by the acte of Parlamēt, or statute made in the xxv. yere of the reigne of ye most noble kyng of famous memory kyng Edward the iii. touching, or cōcerning treason, or the declarations of treasons: & suche offences as hereafter shall by thys present acte be expressed & declared to bee treason, or petit treason, and none other, nor that any peynes of deathe, penaltie, or forfeyture in any wise insue, or be to any of the offendors, for the doyng or committing any treason, or petit treason, other then such as be in the said estatute made in the sayd xxv. yere of the reigne of the saide kynge Edward the iii. or by thys present estatute ordeined & prouided: any act or actes of parlamēt, statute or statutes, had, or made at any time heretofore, or after the sayde xxv. yere of the reigne of the said late king Edward the third, or anye other declaration or matter, to the contrarye in anye wise notwithstanding.

And also bee it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaide, that all actes of Parlament and estatutes, touching, mentioning, or in anye wise concerning religion or opinions, that is to say, aswell the Statute made in the first yere of the reigne of the kyngs noble progenitour kynge Richarde the second, and the statute made in the second yere of the reigne of king Henry the v. and the Statute also made in the xxv. yere of the reigne of kyng Henry the eight, concerning punishment and reformation of Heretiques and lollardes, and euery prouision therein conteined, and the statute made for thabolishement of diuersitie of opiniōs, in certain articles concerning Christian religion, commonly called the vi. articles made in the Parlament begonne at Westminster the xxviii. daye of Aprill, in the xxxi. yere of the reigne of the most noble and victorious Prince, of most famous memory kyng Henry the eight, father to oure most dread Soueraine lord the king that now is, and also thact of Parlament and statute made of the Parlament begon at Westminster the xvi. daye of Ianuary, in the xxxiii. yere of the reigne of the said late kyng Henry ye eight and after that proroged vnto the xxii. day of Ianuary, in the xxxiiii. yere of the reigne of the said late kyng Henry the eight, touching, mēcioning, or in any wise cōcerning bokes of thold and new testament in English, and the Printing, vttering, sellyng, geuing, or deliueringe of bookes, or writtinges, and reteining of English bookes or writings, and reading, preaching, teaching, or expounding of scripture, or in any wise touching, mencioning, or concerning any of the same matters. And also one other statute made in the parlament holden at Westminster, in the xxxv. yere of the reigne of the said late kyng Henry the eight, concerning the qualification of the statute of vi. articles, & all & euery other act or actes of parlament, concerning doctrine, or matters of religion, & all and euery branche, article, sentence, and matter, peines & forfeitures cōteined, mentioned, or in any wise declared, in any of the same actes of parlament, or estatutes, shal frō hēceforth be repeled, & vtterly voide & of none effect.

And bee it further ordeined and enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayd, that all offences made felony, by any acte or actes of parlament, statute, or statutes, made sithens the xxiii. daye of Aprill, in the firste yere of the reigne of the sayd late kyng Henry the eight, not being felony before, & also, all and euery the braunches and articles mentioned, or in any wise declared, in any of the same statutes, concerning the makyng of any offence or offences, to be felony, not being felony before: and all peynes & forfeitures, concerning the same, or anye of them, shal from henceforthe be repealed, and vtterly voide and of none effect.

And bee it also ordeyned & enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, that one acte made in the Parlament holden at Westminster, in the xxxi. yere of the reigne of the sayd late kyng Henry the eight, that proclamacions made by the kyngs hyghnesse, by the aduise of hys honorable counsaile, shoulde bee obeyed and kepte, as though they were made by aucthoritie
of a parlament: and also one other act made in the Parlament holdē in the xxiiii. yere of the reigne of the said late king Henry the eight, for the due execution of the said proclamations, & also all & euery braunche, article & matter in the same statutes, & euery of thē mēcioned or declared shal from hencefoorth be repealed, and vtterly voide, and of none effect.

And bee it enacted by thaucthoritie aforesayde, that yf any persone or persones, at any tyme after the firste daye of Marche next comming, by open preaching, expresse words or sayinges, do affirme, or set forth, that the kyng, hys heires or successoures kynges of this realme for the time being is not, or ought not to bee supreme head in earth of the Church of England and Ireland, or any of them, immediately vnder God, or that the bishop of Rome, or any other person or persons, other then the kyng of Englande for the time being is, or ought to bee by the lawes of God, supreme head of the same churchs, or of any of thē, or that the kyng, his heires or successoures kyngs of thys realme, is not, or ought not to bee kyng of England, Fraunce and Ireland, or of any of them, or after the sayd first day of Marche, doe compasse or imagine by open preachinge, expresse woordes, or sayinges, to depose or depriue the kyng, hys heirs; or successours kyngs of thys realme, from hys, or theire Royal estate, or titles, to, or of the realmes aforesayd, or doe openly publishe, or say by expresse wordes or sayinges, that any other persone, or persons, other thē the kyng, hys heirs or successours kynges of thys realme, of right ought to be kyngs of the realmes aforesaid, or any of them, or to haue & enioy the same, or anye of them: that then euerye suche offendor being thereof duely conuicted, or attainted by the lawes of thys realme, their aidors, cōforters, abbettors, procurours, and counsailours, for his or their such first offence, shall lose and forfayte to the kyng, all hys & theire goodes, and cattalles, and also shall haue & suffre imprisonement, of hys & theyr bodies, at the kyngs will and pleasure. And if any persone beyng oure conuicted or attainted of anye of the sayde offences, shall after hys conuiction or attaindour eftsones commit or perpetrate any of the offences before mentioned, other then such as be expressed in the sayde estatute, made in the sayde xxv. yere of kyng Edwarde the iii. and shalbe thereof duely cōuicted or attainted by the lawes of this realme: that then euery such offendor, their aidors, coūforters, abbettours, procurours and coūsaylors, for his, or their said second offence or offences, shall lose and forfayte to the kyng, the whole issues and profites of all hys & their lādes, tenementes, & other hereditamentes, benefices, prebendes, & other spiritual promotions, for terme of life, of suche offendour or offendoures: & shall also lose and forfayte to the kyng all his and their goodes and cattalles, and also suffre, during hys and their lifes, perpetual imprisonmēt of his and their bodies. And if anye persone being two tymes hereafter conuicted or attainted of any of the same offences, shall after his said second conuiction or attainder, eftsons commit or perpetrate again any of
the said offences to be therof duely conuicted or attainted by the lawes and statutes of thys realme: that then euery such third offence or offences, shalbe demed and adiudged hygh treason, and the offendor or offendors, their aidors, comfortors, abbettours, procurours, & counsailours, being therin conuicted or attainted, according to the lawes & statuts of thys realme, shalbe deemed and adiudged hyghe traitours, & shal suffre peines of deathe, and lose and forfaite all theire goodes and cattalles, landes and tenementes, to the kyng, as in cases of hygh treason.

And be it further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayd, that if any persone or persones, at any time after the sayd first day of March next comming, by writing, printing, ouert deede or acte, doe affirme, or sett forth, that the kyng of thys realme for the tyme being, is not, or ought not to be supreme head in earth of the churche of England and Ireland, or of any of thē, immediately vnder God: or shall, by writing, printing, ouert deede, or acte, after the sayd first daye of Marche, affirme, or set forth, yt the bishop of Rome, or any other person or persons, other then the kyng of Englande for the time being, is, or ought to be by the lawes of God, or otherwise, the supreme head in earth of the same churches, or of anye of them: or do after the said first day of March, compasse, or imagine by writing, printing, ouert deede or acte, to depose or depriue the kyng, hys heires or successours kyngs of thys realme, frō his, or their royal estate, or titles of the kyng of Englande, Fraunce, and Irelande, or of anye of them: or by any writing, printing, ouert dede, or acte, do affirme, yt any other persone or persons, other then the kyng, hys heirs and successours is, or of right ought to be king of the realmes of Englande, Fraunce, or Ireland, or to haue and enioy the same, or any of them: that then euery suche offence and offences, shalbe demed and adiudged hyghe treason, & thoffendour & offendours, their aidours, cōforters, abbettors, {pro}curers, and counsailours therin cōuicted or attainted, according to the lawes & statutes of thys realme, shalbe demed and adiudged hyghe traitours, & shal suffre peines of death, & lose & forfeit al theire goodes and cattales, landes and tenementes, to the kyng, as in cases of hyghe treason.

Prouided always, & be it enacted by thauctoritie aforesayd, that this estatute, or any thing therein conteined, shal not in anye wise extende to repell, adnulle, or make frustrate or voyde, anye acte or actes of Parlament, statute or statutes made, concerninge the counterfeytinge, or forgeing of any of the coynes of thys Realme, or for the coyne of any other realme or realmes, currāt within this realme, or for clipping, washinge, or filing anye of the sayd coines, or for, or concerninge the bringing into thys realme, of counterfaite money or coyne: ne to anye statute made in the xxvii. yere of the said late kyng Henry the eight, concerning the false forgeing and counterfeyting of the kynges sygnes Manuell, priuie signate, or priuie seale, ne to their counsailours, procurors, aidours, and abbettours, nor to any article or braunche concerning the same offences, or
any of them conteined in the same statutes, or any of them.

And be it further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayd, that if any the heires of the king our said souereigne lord that now is, or anye persone or persones, to whom the crowne and dignitie of this realme is limited and appointed by act of parlament, made in the xxxv. yere of the reigne of the said late kyng Henry the eight, or the heires of any of them doe at any time herafter, vsurpe the one of them vpon the other, in the crowne of this realme, or demaūde, challēge, or claime the same, otherwise, or in any other fourme or degre of discent or succession, or in any other course, fourme, degree, or cōdition, but onely in suche maner & fourme, as is declared by the said estatute: or if any of the saide heires, or persons aforesayde, do interrupt, or let the kyngs hyghnesse that now is, peaceablye & quietly to kepe, haue, and enioy the sayd imperial Crowne: that then, all & singular the offendors, their aidors, conforters, abbettors, procurors, and counsailors therein, shalbe demed and adiudged hygh traitors, and shall suffre and incurre the peines of death, losse and forfeitures, as is aforesayd, in cases of hyghe treason.

And it is further ordeyned & enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, that no person or persons, that heretofore hath been, or at any tyme herafter shalbe, in due fourme of the lawes attainted or cōuicted of murder or malice prepensed, or of poisoning of malice prepensed, or of breakynge of any house by day or by night, any persone being then in ye same house, where the same breaking heretofore hath been, or hereafter shalbe committed, and heretofore hath been, or herafter shalbe, thereby put in feare or dreade, or of, or for robbing of any person or persons in the high way, or nere to the high waye, or for felonious stealing of horses, geldynges, or mares; or of felonious taking of any goodes out of any parish church or other churche, or chappel, or being indicted or appealed of anye of the same offences, and thereupon found gyltie by verdict of xii. men, or shall confesse the same, vpon hys or their arreignement, or will not aunswere directly, according to the lawes of this realme, or shal stande wilfully, or of malice mute, shall not bee admitted to haue or enioye the priuilege or benefite of hys clergie or Sanctuary, but shalbe put from the same: and that in all other cases of felonie, other then suche as before mentioned, all and singuler persone & persones, which after the first daye of March next comming, shalbe arreigned or founde gyltie, vpon his or their arreignement, or shal confesse the same, or stand mute in fourme aforesayd, or will not aunswere directly in fourme abouesaid, shal haue and enioy the priuilege and benefite of his or their clergie, the libertie and priuilege of Sanctuarye, in like maner and fourme, as he or they might, or shoulde haue doen, before the xxiiii. day of April, in the firste yere of the reigne of the sayd late kyng Henry the eight.

Prouided alwayes, and be it enacted by the auctoritie aforesayde, that all clauses, articles, and sentences, mentioned, or specified in any acte or
actes of parlament, statute or statutes made in the tyme of the reigne of the sayde late kyng Henry the eight, touching, or in any wise concerning any maner of challenge, for the Countie, Hundred, or peremptory challenge, or any of them, or touching, or in any wise concerning any maner of triall of forein plees pleded by murtherers, felons, or other offendors shall, as cōcerning the said challenges and trials, remaine in theire force and strength not repealed, any thing in thys act mentioned, sounding or seming to the contrary, in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided also, and be it ordeyned and enacted by the auctoritie aforesayde, that thys act of parlament, or any thing therin mēcioned as cōcerning the repeale of anye estatute or estatutes made touching treason, or misprision of treason, shal not in any wise geue any maner of benefit, aduauntage, or commoditie, to any persone or persones, being the last day of Octobre laste past, arrestest, or imprisoned for treason, petit treason, or misprision of treason, or to any person or persons heretofore being indicted of treason, petit treason, or misprision of treason, or to any other persone or persons being likewise conuicted, outlawed, or attainted of treason, petit treason, or misprision of treason: or beyng fled beyond the seas, or into Scotlande, before the sayde laste daye of Octobre laste paste, for any treason, petit treason, or misprision of treason: but that they & euery of them, shal suffre suche peines of death, losses and forfeitures of landes and goodes, as in cases of treason, as though thys acte had neuer been had or made: any thing in thys acte to the cōtrarie in any wise notwithstanding: & that the lawes & statutes repealed by thys act shall stand against thē: & euery of thē, in full strength, vertue, force and effect, concerning all & euery offence by thē, or any of thē, hertofore cōmitted or doen.

Prouided also, and be it ordeined and enacted, by the auctoritie aforesayde, that all wilfull killinge, by poisoning of anye persone or persones, that at anye time hereafter shalbe doen, perpetrated, or committed, shalbe adiudged, takē, and demed wilful murders of malice prepensed: and that the offendors therin, their aidors, abbettours, procurours, & counsailours, shall suffre death, and forfait in euery behalfe, as in other cases of wilfull murder of malice prepensed.

And ouer that, bee it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, that in all and euery case and cases, where any of the kynges Maiesties subiectes shall & maye vpon hys prayer, haue the priuilege of clergie, as a Clerke conuict, that may make purgation in all those cases, and euery of them, and also in all and euery case and cases of felony, wherein the priuilege and benefite of clergie is restreined, excepted, or takē away by thys estatute, or acte, (wilful murder, and poysoning of malice prepensed, onelye excepted) the Lorde and lordes of the parlament, and pere and peres of the realme hauing place and voyce in parlament, shall by vertue of thys present acte of common grace, vpon hys, or theire request or praier, alleging thathe is a Lorde, or pere of this realme, & claiminge the benefite
of thys act, though he cānot reade, without any burning in ye hand, losse of inheritaunce, or corruption of hys bloud, be adiudged, dem •• , taken, & vsed, for hys first tyme onely, to all intentes, cōstructions, & purposes, as a clerke conuict, & shall in case of a clerke conuict, whiche maye make purgation, without any further or other benefite or priuilege of clergie, to any such Lorde or pere, frō thenceforth at any tyme after, for any case to be allowed, adiudged, or admitted: any lawe, statute, vsage, custome, or any other thing to the contrary, in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, that if anye of the sayde Lordes of the parlament, or any of the peres of thys realme for the time being, shal fortune to bee indicted of any of the offences limitted in thys act: that thē they 〈◊〉 entry of them, shal haue hys or their triall by their peeres, as it hath been vsed heretofore, in cases of hygh treason.

And bee it further enacted by the auctoritie aforesayd, that yf any persone or persones, that by thys statute, or by any other statutes or lawes of thys realme ought to haue, or bee admitted, to the benefite of hys, or their clergie: that the same persone and persones, shalbe from hēceforth admitted & allowed, to hys or their clergie, although they, or any of thē, haue ben diuers & sundrye times maried, to any single woman, or single women, or to anye widowe, or widowes, or to two wiues, or mo: anye law, statute, or vsage, to the contrarye in anye wise notwithstanding.

And ouer that, it is ordeyned and enacted by the auctoritie aforesaide, that albeit any persone, or persones, of what estate, cōdiciō, or degree, he or they be, shal hereafter fortune to be attainted, conuicted, or outlawed of anye treason, petit treason, misprision of treason, murder, or Felonye whatsoeuer, yet that notwithstanding, euery womā, that is, or shall fortune to bee wife of the persone so attainted, conuicted, or outlawed, shalbe endowable and enable to demaunde, haue, and enioye her dower, in like maner and fourme, as though her husband had not been attainted, conuicted, or outlawed: any statute, lawe, vsage, or custome, to the contrarye in any wise notwithstanding. Sauing to all and euery other persone and persones, bodies politike and corporate, theire heires and successors, and to euery of them, other then to such offendour or offendours as shalbe attainted, conuicted, or outlawed, all such right, title, interest, entree, leases, possession, condition, profit, commoditie, and hereditamentes, as they or any of them had, or should, or of right ought to haue, before, or at the time of the sayd attainder, conuiction, or outlagarie.

Prouided also, and be it enacted, by the auctoritie aforesayde, that one acte made at the Parlament holden at Westminster, vpon diuers prorogations, the iiii. day of February, in the xxvii. yere of the sayd late kynge Henry the eighte, and there continued and kept, vntill the xxiiii. daye of Aprill then next ensuing, concerning and touching the felonious taking awaye by anye seruaunt, the goodes or cattalles, of the maister or maistresse, and all Articles and Sentences conteyned in the same acte, shall
stande, be, and remaine in full strength, force, and effecte, in suche maner and fourme, as it did before the making of thys present act, the repeael, or reuocation of the acts abouesayde, to the contrary notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, and be it enacted by the auctoritie abouesaid, that no persone or persones shal in any wise be impeched, or put to aunswere for any of thoffences abouesaid, cōcerning treasons, by open preaching, or wordes onely, vnlesse the partie offendor or offendors bee thereof accused within xxx. dayes next after the same opē preaching, or wordes so spoken or declared, if thaccusours shal fortune to be within thys realme, during the sayde space of xxx. dayes, next after the sayd offence cōmitted or doen. And if the accusors shal happen to be out of this realme, during the said space of xxx. daies: then the partie or parties so offending, shalbe accused, as is aforesayde, within sixe monethes, next after the same preaching, or wordes spoken or declared: or els the partie or parties so offending, their aidors, comforters, abbettours, and counsailours, or anye of thē not to be empeached, or put to aunswere for any such offence, or offēces, & yt the same accusation, or accusatiōs so to be had, made, & declared, shalbe made to one of the kyngs counsaile, or to one of the kyngs Iustices of Assise, or els to one of the kynges Iustices of peace beynge of the Quorum, or to two Iustices of the peace, within the Shyre, where the same offence or offences shal happen to be doen or committed: any thing cōteyned in thys act to the cōtrary therof in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided also, & bee it declared and enacted by the aucthoritie abouesayde, that concelement, or keping secrete anye high treason, shalbe from henceforth adiudged, demed, & taken, misprision of treason, & the offendor therein shall forfayte and suffre, as in cases of misprision of treason, as heretofore hath been vsed: any thyng aboue mencioned to the contrarye notwithstanding.

Prouided also, & be it declared & enacted by the auctoritie abouesaid, that thys acte or any thing therein conteyned, shall not extende to charge, or make any persone or persones to bee offendor or offendors, in any of ye articles abouesaid, for calling, naming, saying, writing, or printinge the Frenche kyng, for the tyme beyng, by ye name of the kyng of Fraūce or Frenche kyng, any thing aboue declared and enacted, to the contrary in anye wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, and bee it enacted by the auctoritie aforesayd, that no persone or persones, after the firste daye of Februarye next comming shalbe indicted, arreygned, condemned, or conuicted, for anye offence of treason, petit treason, misprision of treason, or for anye woordes before specified, to bee spoken after the sayd firste daye of February, for whiche the same offendoure, speaker, offendours, or speakers, shall in anye wise suffre any peynes of death, imprisonment, losse, or forfeiture of his goodes, cattalles, landes or tenementes: vnlesse the same offendor, speaker, offendours, or speakers bee accused by two sufficient and lawefull witnesses,
as shall willingly without violence confesse the same.

div.head: ¶ An act for a Subsidie of tonnage & poundage of merchaundise, with a prouiso for the confirmation of the Priuileges of the merchauntes of the Styliard, which prouiso shall induce but onely to thende of thys Parlament. ¶ The .xiii. Chapiter.
div.p:
IN their most humble wise shewen vnto your most excellent Maiestie, your poore cōmons in thys your present parlament assembled, that wher aswel your most dearest father of famous memorie kyng Henry ye viii. as also your most worthy graundfather kyng Hēry ye vii. & other your noble {pro}genitours kings of this your realme of Englād, time out of minde, haue had, graūted vnto them, & enioyed of the cōmons of the same realme, for the tyme being, by auctoritie of parlamēt, for the defence of the same nowe youre realme, & the keping & safegarde of the seas for thētercourse of merchādise, safely to come into the same youre Realme, & to passe out of ye same, certain sommes of money, named subsidies, of all maner of gooddes and merchaūdises, cōming in, or going out of the same your realme: & forasmuch as we your said poore cōmōs haue {per}ceiued your Maiesties good fauour & will towards vs your said poore cōmons, had aswel in the defence of vs, & this your realme, against your rebels the Scottes, as also the keping & sure defending of the Seas, against all persons intending the disturbance & inuasion of thys your realme, & vs your said cōmōs to our great cōfort & reioising, as cause requireth, & to your maiestie great costes, charges, & expences, & also not doubting the sequele of the same if nede shall require: We therfore your said poore cōmons, as bounden of duetie, humbly desire your excellēt Maiestie benignely & fauourably to take, accept, & receiue these our poore graūts herafter ensuing, as graūted of true hartes & good willes, which we beare to your hyghenes, towardes your said great costes, charges & expences, aswel heretofore expended & laid out, as herafter by your Maiestie for the causes aforesaid, whē nede shal require, to be expēded & laid out, as the first fruits of our good willes & hartes toward your highnesse, although the same doe, or herafter shal nothing in effect counteruaile your saide costes, charges, & expēces, which we be not able fully to gratifie by any meanes. First, we your poore cōmons, by the aduise & assent of the Lords spiritual & tēporall, in thys youre present Parlament assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, to thintent aforesaid, geue and graunt to you oure said Souereigne Lord, one subsidie called tonnage, that is to saye, of euery tōne of wine comming, or that shal, or is come into thys your realme, by way of merchādise, the summe of iii.s. & so after the rate: & of euery tonne of swete wine, aswel malmesey as other that shall, or is come into the same your realme, by euery or any merchant alien, aswel by the merchaūts of
Haunse and Almayne, as by any other merchant straunger, of what nacion soeuer he bee iii.s. and so after the rate, ouer & aboue the iii.s. afore graunted. And of euery awlne of Renishe wine comming, or that shal, or is come into thys your realme, by way of merchaundise, by euery, or any merchaunt, denizen, or alien, of what nation soeuer he be xii.d. And also one other subsidie, called pōdage, that is to saye, of all maner of goodes and merchaundises, of euerye Marchaunt, Denizen and alien whatsoeuer he be, caried, & to be caried, out of this your said realme, or brought or to be brought into the same by waye of merchaūdises of the value of euery .xx.s. of the same goodes and merchaundises xii.d. and so after the rate. And of xx.s. value of Tinne and Pewter vessell caried oute of thys your realme by any and euery merchaūt alien xii.d. ouer and aboue the xii.d. aforesaid. Except alwayes and forprised out of thys graunt of subsidie of poundage, all maner of wollen cloth made and wrought, or that shalbe made and wrought within thys realme of England, & by euerye, or anye merchaunte denizen and not borne alien, caried or to bee caried out of thys your saide realme, and all maner of wolle, wolle felles, & hides, and barkes of Lether also caried, or to be caried out of thys your realme, and all wines, and all maner of freshe fishe and bestial, comming, or that is, or shal come into the same your realme.

And further, we your sayde poore commons by the aduise, assent, and aucthoritie aforesayd, geue and graunt vnto you our said Souereigne Lorde, for the causes aboue rehearsed, one other Subsidie of all maner of wolle, wolle felles, & lether caried, or to be caried out of this your realme, in maner and fourme folowing, that is to say of euery merchant denizen of, & for euery sacke of woll xxxiii.s.iiii.d. And of euery cc.xl. wolfelles .xxxiii.s. iiii.d. And of, and for euerye laste of hydes and backes, of euery suche merchaunt denizen .iii. li. vi.s. viii.d. And also of euerye merchaunt straunger not borne your liege man, aswell those that bee made denizens, as hereafter shalbe made by letters patentes or otherwise, as all other merchaunt straungers, of, and for euery sacke of wolle .iii. li. vi. s. viii.d. And, of, & for euerye .cc.xl. wollefelles .iii. li. vi.s. viii.d. And also of euery last of hydes and backes .iii. li. xiii.s. iiii.d. And so of all the said wolles, wollefelles, hydes & backes, & euery of them, after the rate that so is, or shalbe caried, to haue, take, enioye, and perceaue the subsidies aforesaide, & euery of thē, & euery part or parcel of them to your hyghnes from the first daye of your most noble reigne, during your lyfe natural.

And further, we your sayde poore commons most humblye desire your Maiestie, that it may be enacted by your hyghnesse, by the aduise & assēt of the Lordes aforesayde, and vs your sayde commons, and by the foresayde auctoritie of thys present Parlament assembled, that the giftes & grauntes aforesayde, shalbee good and effectual, accordinge to the true meaning of the same. And that it may be further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, yt yf any wines, goodes, merchaundises, wolles, wollefelles,
hydes, & backes of leather aforesaide, or other thyngs afore specifyed wherof the subsidies aforesaid, or any of them, is or shalbe hereafter due, shall at any time hereafter, during the time aforesaid, be shipped or put into any boate, craier, ship or vessel, to that intent to be caried into the partes of beyond the sea, or els be brought from the partes of beyōd the sea, into any port, hauē, creeke, or other place of this your realme by way of marchandise and there laide on lande, the Subsidye aforesaid of the same (due or to be due by reason of this graūt) not paied, or the collectour of the same Subsidy not agreed with for the same according to the true meanyng and intent of these aforesaid grauntes, and euery of them: that then from the first day of March next cōmyng and not before, al the said wines, goods, merchaundises, woolles, wolfelles, hides and backes, and other the premisses aforesaide, and euerye parte and parcel therof so shipped or els put into any boate, craier, or other vessel afore saide, to thintent afore said, or brought into this realme and there laid on land, as is also aforesaid, shal remaine forfait to your highnes, during the time aforesaid: the one moity thereof, or the value therof to your highnesse, and the other moyty to him or them that shall sease the same or sue for the same. And that it may please your highnes that al marchaunts aswell Denizons as straungers, coming into thys your realme, be well & honestly intreated & demeaned, as they were in the time of your aforesaid noble progenitors wythout oppressiō to thē to be done, paying the Subsidies abouesaid.

And ferther, that it be enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaid, that if any goods, merchaūdises, wolles, wollfelles or leather aforesaid, or any part therof of any merchaunt denizon, naturally borne your liege man, which shall passe out of this your said realme, after the said first day of Matche, during the terme of this giftes and graunt, shal happen to be taken with enemies of pirates vppon the sea, or perished by misfortune in any ship or ships, that shal happen to be taken or peryshed within the time of the said graunt, wherof the Subsidies aforesaid or anye of thē to your highnes due or to be due, is, or shal be in forme aforesaid duely payed or agreed for without fraude or collusion, and such losse or losses as ben before rehearsed, be found and proued before the Treasorer of England, or the chiefe Baron of our Eschequer for the time being, by the examinacion of the same merchaunts if they be on liue, or of theire executours or administrators, if they be dead, or two true credible persons sworne, or other reasonable witnes & profes sworne, wytnessinge the same merchaūdises so to be lost or perished: that then the same merchaunts denizons that were or shalbe owners of the aforesayd goods merchauntes, woolle, wollfelles, hydes or other merchaundises aforesaid, as shall be so perished or lost, if they be on liue, or their executours and admynystratours, if they bee dead, and euerye of them, by force and vertue of this acte when them liketh, duringe the said terme, shall
moue ship asmuche wolle, wollefelles, hides or other marchaūdise in ye same porte or ports, in whiche the same woll, wollfelles, hides, or other goods and marchaundises aforesayd, so lost & perished, were or shall be shipped without any of the subsidies aforesayd now graūted, to be had or paied therfore to you in any wise, and that al such profites of the premisses so to be lost or perished, be certifyed into your Chaūcery, by your said treasorer or chief Baron, there to remaine of record, and after such certificat made the Chauncellor of England, or the Lord keper of your great seale, for the time being, do make and deliuer vnto the said merchauntes, their executors or administrators, or any of them, or to their attorney or to their attorneis in that behalfe, or any of them, as manye and suche writtes and warranties to be directed as well to the collectours of the subsidies aforesaid, or any, or euery of them for the time being, as to the treasorer & barons of your Eschequer for the time beyng as shalbe requisite and nedeful for the said merchaūts, their executors or administratours or their attorney or attorneys, or any of thē, or the saide collectors or any of them, to haue for the obtayning, aswel of the shipping, as of allowance therof: And ferther that euery marchaūt denizen that shal ship hereafter any woll, wollfelles, hides, or anye other gooddes & marchaundises in any carricke or galley, shall paye to your Maiestie during the time aforesaide, all maner of customes and al the subsidies aforesaide, as any alien borne out of this your realme.

Prouided alwaies, that no acte, statute, or ordinaunce had, made or to be made in this present Parlament, be in any wise hurtfull or preiudicial vnto the merchaunts of the Hause in Almaine, hauing the house in the citie of London, comonly called Guilhalda Theutonicorum, nor to any fraunchises, liberties or priuileges to them or their predecessors before this time had, agreed, graunted or confirmed, nor to any lawful vsages by them or by their predecessors before this time vsed, but that the saide merchauntes and their successors haue, holde, and enioye, all their saide fraunchises, libertyes, and free vsages, accordynge to suche grauntes, confirmacions and agrementes, as by the kynge and his noble progenitors kinges of Englande haue beene agreed, made & graūted and had to the said merchaunts or theire predecessours, and according to their lawfull vsages in euery thing, by whatsoeuer other name or names, the same merchaūts, or any of them be called, or named: any acte, statute, or ordinaunce made or to be made in this present Parlyament to the contrary notwithstanding: This present prouiso to endure and continue vnto the ende of this present parliament.

div.head: ¶ The .xiiii. Chapiter. ¶ An acte whereby certaine Chaunteries, Colleges, free chappelles, and the possessions of the same, be geuen to the kyngs Maiestie.
div.p:
THe kinges most louing subiects, the lordes Spiritual & temporal, & the cōmons in this present parliamente assembled, considering yt a great part of supersticyō & errours in Christian religion, hath been brought into ye mindes & estimaciō of men, by reason of ye ignorance of their very true & perfit saluaciō, through ye death of Iesus Christ, & by deuising & phātasiyng vain opinions of purgatorie, & masses satisfactorie, to be done for them, which be departed: The which doctrine & vain opiniō, by nothyng more is maīteined and vpholden then by the abuse of Trentalles, Chauntries, and other prouisions made for the continuaunce of the saide blindnesse and ignoraunce. And ferther considering and vnderstanding that the alteracion, chaunge, & amendement of the same, & conuerting to good and godly vses, as in erecting Grāmer Scholes to the educacion of youth in vertue and godlines, the further augmenting of the Vniuersities, & better prouision for the poore and needie, cannot in this presente Parlamente be prouided, and conuenientlye done, nor cannot, ne oughte to anye other maner persone be committed, then to the Kinges highnesse, whose Maiestie, with, and by the aduise of his highnes most prudente Counsaile, can & wil most wisely, and beneficially bothe for the honour of God, and the weale of his Maiesties Realme, order, alter, conuerte, and dispose the same. And calling furder to their remembraunce that in the Parlament holden at Westminster the, xxxvii. yeare of the reigne of our late Soueraigne Lorde kynge Henrye the eighte, father to our moste dreade and natural Soueraigne Lorde the kynge, that now is it was ordeined, enacted, and established emongst other thynges, that al & singuler Colleges, free Chappelles, Chauntries, Hospitalles, Fraternities, Brotherheddes, Guildes, and other promocions, mencioned in the saide former act, had, or made to haue continuance in perpetuitie for euer, and then being, or that hadde, or ought to bee contributorie or chargeable to the payment of the first fruites and tenthes, accordynge to the lawes and statutes in that behaulfe hadde, and made by what name, surname, degree, or corporaciō, they, or any of thē were founded ordeined, established, erected, named, called, or knowen: and al and singuler the mansion houses, manours, orchardes, gardens, landes, tenementes, pastures woods, waters, rentes, reuercions, seruices, cōmons, tythes, pencions, porcions, churches, chappelles, aduowsons, nomynacions, patronages, annuities, rightes, interestes, entrees, condiciōs leetes, courtes, liberties, priuileges, fraunchises, & other hereditamēts whatsoeuer, then apperteining, or belonging, or ye did appertain, or belong, or were assigned, or appointed to anye suche colledge, free chapel chauntrye, hospital, fraternitie, brotherhed, guilde, stypendiare prycste or other the saide promocions, or to any of thē, or accepted, knowen, or takē as part, parcel, or member of them, or of any of them: & to the said
Colleges, chauntryes, free chappelles, hospytalles, fraternytyes, brotherhed, guylde, stipendarie pryestes, or other promocions, or to any of thē vnited, or annexed: which betwene the .iiii. day of February, in the xxvii. yere of the saide late kings reigne, & the .xxv. day of December in the .xxxvii. of his graces reigne, by reason of any entree, expulsion, bargain, sale, feoffement, fine, recouerie, leasse, or other conueighance therof made, were dissolued, determined, or relinquished by any of ye waies meanes, or conueighaunces, mencioned in the saide acte, or otherwyse other then such of them, as then were in the possessyon of the saide late king, or that weee graunted, or assured by his licence, agrement, cōsent or letters patents, to any person or persons, or then had ben lawfullye obteined, or recouered by any person, by any former right, or title, with out fraude or couin, or by the kyngs licence, shal frō thenceforth by aucthoritie of the same former acte, be adiudged & demed, & also bee in the very actual and real possession & seison of the saide late king, and of his heires and successours for euer: in as large & ample maner, as the saide priestes, wardens, masters, ministers, gouernours, rulers, or other incumbents, or any of them, or the patrons, donours, or foundours of any of them at any time sithens the said fowerth day of February in the xxvii. yere aforesayd, had, occupied, or enioyed, or then had, occupied, or enioyed the same, & as though all and singuler the said colleges, chauntries, hospitalles, free chappelles, fraternities, brotherheddes, guildes and other the saide promocions, and the saide manours, Landes, tenementes, hereditamentes, and other the premisses, whatsoeuer they be, & euery of them, had been in the said former acte, specially, particulerly, & certaynly rehearsed, named, & expressed by expresse woordes, names, surnames, corporaciōs, titles, and faculties, and in their natural kinds and qualities: the saide entrees, expulsions, bargaines, sales, fynes, feoffements, recoueries, or other assurance, and conueyghaunce whatsoeuer they were, had, or made (except before in the former act excepted) to the contrary notwithstanding. And where also it was enacted and graunted by the saide late king, by the saide former acte, that the same late king during his natural lyfe, might make and direct his commissiō and commissions vnder his great seale, to entre into al & singuler suche and as manye chauntryes, free chappelles, hospytalles, colleges, and other the promocions mencioned in the saide former acte, & into al and singuler suche manours, mansions, houses, measses, lands, tenements, pastures, wooddes, waters, rentes, reuercions, seruices, possessions, & other heredytaments whatsoeuer, or into any parte, or parcell thereof in the name, season, and possessyon of all the hereditamentes, annexed, vnited, belonging, or apperteining to any chauntry, hospital, free chappel, college, fraternytie, brotherhed, guilde, or other the saide promocions, or wherof any priestes, prouostes, gouernours, rulers, or other incumbentes, of them, or any of them, by what name, surname, degree,
title, or corporacion, they, and euery of them, or anye of them were foūded, erected, ordeined, established, named, called, or knowē, then had or enioyed, or that hereafter should haue, or enioye to the said chauntries hospitalles, free chappelles, colledges, fraternityes, brotherheds, guildes, or other the saide promocions that then were chargeable to ye payment of the first fruites, and tenthes: & all colleges that were chargeable, or not chargeable to the said payment of the first fruites & tenthes as is aforesaide, or to any of them, as should be named, expressed & appointed in the sayde commission or commissions: and to seise and take the same chauntries, hospitalles, colleges, free chappelles, fraternities, brotherheddes, guildes, and other the saide promocions, manors, lāds tenementes, and other the premisses mencioned in the saide commissyon or commissyons, and in euery of them, and euerye parte, parcell, and member of the same into the kinges possession and handes, to haue and to holde the same to the saide late king, and to hys heires & successors, for euer, as by the saide former act emongst other things more at large appeareth: it is now ordeyned and enacted by the king our soueraigne Lorde with the assent of the lordes and commons in this present Parliament assembled, and by the aucthoritie of the same, that al maner of colleges, free chappelles, and chauntries, hauing, being, or in esse, with-fiue yeares nexte before the firste daye of this presente Parlyamente, which were not in actual and reall possessyon of the saide late king, nor in the actual and real possession of the kyng our soueraygne lorde that now is, nor excepted in the said former acte in fourme abouesaid, other then suche as by the kings commissyons in fourme hereafter mēcioned shalbe altered, transposed, or chaunged, and all manours, landes, tenementes, rentes, tithes, pencions, porcions, and other hereditamentes, and thinges aboue mencioned, belonging to them or any of them: and also al Manours, landes, tenementes, rentes, and other hereditamēts and thinges aboue mencyoned by any maner of assuraunce, conueyghance, wil, deuise, or otherwise, had, made, suffered, knoweleged, or declared, geuen, assigned, limytted, or appoynted to the findinge of anye Priest, to haue continuaunce for euer, and wherewith, or whereby any priest was susteined, mainteined, or founde within fiue yeres nexte before the first day of this present parliament, whiche were not in the actual and real possession of the saide late kyng, nor in the actual and real possession of our soueraigne lorde the king that now is: and also, al annual rents, profites, and emolumentes at any time within fiue yeares next before the begynning of this present Parliament, emploied, paied or bestowed, toward, or for ye maintenaunce, supportacion, or finding of any stipendarie prieste, intending by any acte, or wryting to haue cōtinuaunce for euer, shall by the aucthoritie of this presente Parliament, immediatlye after the feast of Easter next comming, be adiudged & demed, and also be in the very actual and real possession and season of the
king our souereigne lord, & his heires, and successors for euer, without anye office or other inquisicion thereof to bee had, or founde, and in as large and ample maner and fourme, as the priestes, wardens, masters ministers, gouernours, rulers, or other incumbentes of them, or any of them, at any time within fiue yeres next before the beginninge of thys present Parliament, had, occupied or enioyed, or now hath, occupyeth, or enioyeth the same, and as though all and singuler the said Colleges free chappelles, chauntries, stipendes, salaries of priestes, and the saide manours, landes, tenementes, hereditamentes, and other the premisses whatsoeuer they be, & euery of them, were in this present acte specially, particulerly, and certeinlye rehearsed, named, and expressed by expresse woordes, names, surnames, corporacions, titles, and faculties, & in their natures, kindes, and qualities.

And ouer that be it ordeined and enacted by the aucthoritye of this present parliament, that where anye mannours, landes, tenementes, tithes, pencions, porcions, rentes, profites, or other hereditaments, by any maner of assuraunce, conueighaunce, wil, deuise, or other wise at any time heretofore had, made, suffred, knowledged, or declared, were geuen, assigned, or appointed, to, or for, the maintenaunce, sustentacion, or finding of one priest, or of diuers pryests for terme of certain yeres yet continuing, and that any priste hath been mainteined, susteyned, or found with the same, or with the reuenues, or profites thereof wythin fiue yeres last, past, that the king from the saide feast of Easter next cōming, shall haue and enioy in euery behalfe, for, and during al such time to come, euery suche, and like thinges, tenementes, heredytamentes, profites, and emolumentes, as the priest, or priestes oughte, or shoulde haue had, for, or toward his, or their maintenaūce, sustenaunce, or fynding, & for no lenger, or further time, nor for any other profit, auaūtage or commoditie therof to be taken.
