Prouyded alwaies, and it is ordeined & enacted by the aucthoritye of this present parliament, that when & assone as the time assigned, for the maintenaunce, sustentacion, or finding of the prieste, or priestes shall be expired and runne: that then it shalbe lawfull to euery person & persones, to whome any Manours, landes, tenementes, tithes, porcions, pēcions, rents, and other hereditamētes, or any of them should haue be longed, or apperteined, if the saide former Act and this Acte had neuer bene had, or made, to enter into, take, perceiue, haue and enioy the same without any maner of liueri, ouster le maine, peticion, or other suit to be made to the Kinge, in like maner, fourme, and condicion, to all entents construccions, and purposes, as though the saide former Acte and this Acte had neuer bene had, or made, and as though the Kinge had neuer had any season or possession therof. Any thing in the sayde former Acte or in this Acte, to the contrary in any wyse notwithstanding.

And be it ordeined and enacted by thaucthoritie of this present parliament,
that the king our souereigne lorde, his heires, and successours from the saide feast of Easter next comming, shall haue hod, perceiue, & enioy for euer al landes, tenementes, rentes, and other hereditaments which by any maner of assuraunce, conueighaunce, willes, will, deuise, or otherwise at any time heretofore had, made, suffred, knowleged, or declared, were geuen, assigned, or appoynted to goe, or bee employed whollye to the fynding, or maintenaunce of any anniuersarye, or obite or other like thing, entente, or purpose, or of any lighte, or lampe, in any churche or chappell, to haue continuaunce for euer, whiche hath beene kepte, or mainteined within fiue yeres nexte before the said first day of this present parliament.

And also that where but parte of the issues, or reuenues of any Manours, landes, tenements, rentes, or other hereditamentes hath by any of the waies, or meanes abouesaide bee geuen, assygned, or appoynted to be bestowed, or employed to the finding or maintenaunce of any anniuersarye, or obite or other like thinge, intente, or purpose, or of anye light, or lampe in any churche or chappel, and to haue continuaunce for euer: that then our soueraigne lord the king shall from the sayde feaste of Easter next comming for euer haue, perceiue, and enioy euerye such summes of money, that in any one yere within fiue yeres next before ye first day of this present parliament, hath been expended and bestowed about the finding, or mayntenance of any suche anniuersary, or obyte, or other like thinge, intente, or purpose of any lighte, or lampe, to hym, his heires, and successours for euer, as a rente charge to bee paied yerely at the feastes of Sainct Michaell the Archangell, and the Annunciacyon of our Lady Saincte Mary the Virgin, by euen porcions in the kinges courte of the Augmentacions, and reuenues of his trowne, or in any other court, or courtes, as the king hereafter shall appoynt. And that it shalbe lawful to our saide Soueraigne lord the king, his heirs and successours for none paymente of anye suche summe or summes of money, to distreine in the saide manours, landes, and tenementes of the issues and reuenues, whereof the saide anniuersarye, or obyte, or other like thing, or any such light or lāpe was founde, susteined, or mainteyned. And that for lacke of sufficient distresse, in or vppon anye of the premisses, whereof any of the saide yerely rentes, or summes of money should be paied by the space of one moneth next after, that anye of the saide rentes should be paied, and be not paied within the sayd moneth that then it shalbe lawful to, & for our soueraigne Lorde the kinge, hys heires, and successours by vertue of this present acte, to enter into, and to haue, and possesse, as much of the landes, tenementes, and hereditamentes, wherof the said rent, or rents should be leuied, or paied, as the rent or rentes that should be leuied, or paied out of the fame, dothe, or shall amount or come to in yerely value, and the same lands, tenements and hereditamentes to holde and kepe, and to haue our sayde Souereigne
lord the king, his heires and assignes for euer, or for suche estate as our soueraigne Lord the king, his heirs, or successors, had, or ought to haue had, of, or in the said rent, or rents.

And it is also ordeined and enacted by the aucthoritie of this present Parliamente, that oure soueraigne lorde the kinge, shall from the saide feast of Easter next comming, haue, perceiue, and enioy al and singuler suche summes of moneye, profites, commodyties, and emolumentes, which by vertue of any maner of assuraunce, conueighaunce, cōposicyon, will, deuife, or otherwise, heretofore haue ben geuen, assigned, limitted, or appointed to haue continuance for euer, whiche in any one yeare within fiue yeres next before the beginning of this present parlyament haue bene paied, bestowed, or emploied, by any maner of corporacions, guildes, fraternities, companies, or felowships of mysteryes, or crafts, or any of them, beinge in Englande, Wales, and other the Kyngs dominions, or by the masters, wardeines, gouernours, or other officers, or ministers, or by the master, warden, gouernor, or other officer, or minyster of them, or any of them, towarde, or about the finding, maintenaunce, or sustentacion of any prieste, or priestes, of anye annyuersary, or obit, lampe, light or lights, or other like thing, as is aforesaid, to our saide souereigne Lorde the king, his heires, and successoures for euer: to be paied yerely, as a rent charge, at the feastes of Sainct Michaell the Archaungel, and the Annunciation of our Lady, by euen porcions, in the kyngs court of Augmentacions, and reuenues of his crowne or in any other courte, or courts, as the kyng hereafter shall appoynt. And that it shalbe lawfull to oure saide soueraigne lord the king, his heires and successours for none paymente of anye suche summes, or summe of money, profite, commoditie, or emolumente, or for none payment of anye of them, to distreigne in al yt manors, lands, and tenements of euery suche craftes, corporacions, guildes, fraternityes, companyes, or felowshippes of misteryes or craftes, or any, of them, by whom, or by the masters, wardens, gouernors, or other officers, or ministers, or master wardē, gouernour, or minister, of the whiche any suche sūmes, or sūme of money, profite, commoditie, or emolument, haue or hath been payed bestowed, or employed: And that all and euery of the saide summes of money, profites, commodities, and emolumentes, shal from the feast of Easter next comming, without any maner of inquisicion, or office to be had, or founde, be iudged and demed to be in the actual and real possession of our said Soueraigne Lord the king, in like maner & fourme, to all intentes, construction, & purposes, as if the same had ben particularly and specially mencioned in this present acte.

And furthermore be it ordeined & enacted by aucthoritie aforesayde that the kyng our souereigne Lorde,, shall from the saide feaste of Easter next comming, haue, and enioye to him, his heires, and successours for euer, all fraternities, brotherheddes, and guildes, being within the
Realme of England, and Wales, and other the kings dominions: and al manours, landes, tenementes, and other hereditaments, belonging to them, or any of them other then such corporacions, guildes, fraternityes, companies, and felowshippes of misteries, or crafts, & the manors landes, tenementes, and other heredytamentes, perteining to the said corporacions, guildes, fraternities, companies, and felowships of mysteryes, or craftes aboue mencyoned: and shall by vertue of this acte be iudged and demed, in actuall and real possessyon of our said soueraign Lorde the king his heires, and successours, from the said feast of Easter next comming for euer, without any inquisicions or office therof to be had or found.

And also be it ordeined and enacted by the aucthority aforesaid, that our said souereigne lord the king, hys heires and successours, at his & their will and pleasure may direct his, and theire commissions and cōmyssyon vnder the greate Seale of Englande to suche persones as it shal please him. And that the same commissioners, or twoe of them at the least, shall haue full power and aucthoritie by vertue of this acte, & of the said commissyon, as well to Surueye all and synguler laye corporacyons, guyldes, fraternytyes, companyes, and felowshyppes of mysteries, or craftes incorporate, and euerye of them, as all other thesaide fraternyties, brotherheddes, and guyldes wythin the lymyttes of theire commission, to them directed: And all the Guydences, composicions, bookes of accomptes, and other wrytinges of euery of thē, to the intente thereby to knowe, what money, and other thyngs was payed, or bestowed to the fyndinge, or maintenaunce of anye pryeste, or pryestes anniuersarye, or obite, or other lyke thynge, lyght, or lāpe, by them, or anye of them: as also to inquire, search, and trie by al suche wayes and meanes, as to them shall bee thoughte meete and conuenient, what manoures, landes, tenementes, rentes, and other hereditamentes, profytes, commodytyes, emolumentes, and other thynges be geeuen, lymitted, or appointed to our saide soueraigne lorde the kyng by thys acte wythin the lymittes of theire commyssyon. And also that the same commyssioners or two of them at the least, by vertue of thys acte, and of the commissyon to them directed, shal haue full power and aucthoritie to assigne, and shall appointe in euerye suche place wheare guylde, fraternitye the pryeste, or incumbent of any Chauntrye in esse, the first daye of thys presente Parlyamente by the foundacyon ordynaunce, the firste institucion thereof, shoulde or ought to haue kepte a Grammer Schole, or a preacher, and so hathe doone: sithen the feaste of Sainct Mychael the Archaungell laste paste, landes, tenementes, and other hereditamentes of euerye suche Chauntrye, guylde, and fraternitye to remaine, and continue in successyon to a Schole Mayster, or preacher for euer, for, and towarde the kepynge of a Grammer Schole, or Preachinge, and for suche Godlye ententes, and purposes,
and in such maner and fourme, as the same Commissioners, or twoe of them at the least shal assigne, or appointe: And also to make and ordein a Vicare to haue perpetuitie for euer, in euerye Paryshe churche the first day of this present Parlyamente, beinge a college, free chappel, or chauntrie, or appropried, annexed, or vnited to anye colledge, free chappel; or chauntrie, that shall come to the kynges hands by vertue of this acte, and to endowe euery suche Vicare sufficientlye, hauing respect to his cure and charge, the same endowement to be to euery suche Vicar, and to his successours for euer, without any other licence, or graunte of the kynge, the Bishoppe, or other Officers of the Diocese. And also the saide commissioners, or two of them at the least, shall haue aucthoritye by force of this acte, to assigne in euerye greate Towne, or Parishe, where they shal thinke necessarye to haue moe Priests then one for the ministring of the Sacramentes, within the same Towne, or paryshe, Landes, and tenementes belonginge to any chauntrye, chappelle, or stipendary Priest being within the same towne, or parishe the first day of this present Parliament, to bee to suche persone and persones, as the saide commissioners, or twoe of them at the leaste, shall assygne, or appoint to continue in succession for euer, for, and towardes the suffycyent finding, and maintenance of one, or moe Priestes wythin the same towne or paryshe, as by the saide commissioners, or twoe of them shall bee thought necessarie, or conuenient. And aswel to make ordinaunces and rules, concerning the seruice, vse, and demeanour of euerye suche Priest and Scholemasters, as is aforesaid, to be appointed, as also by what name, or names, he and they shall from henceforth be named and called. And also that the saide commissioners, or twoe of them at the least, shall haue full power and aucthoritie by vertue of this act, and of the saide commissyon to them directed to assigne aswel to euery deane, Master, warden, prouost, and other Incumbente, and minister of any of the saide colledges, free chappelles, or chauntryes, beynge wythin the limittes of theire commission, whiche hereafter shal be dissolued, or determined by vertue of this acte. as to euerye Stypendarye Priest, and other Priest, whose Salary the king shalbe intituled vnto by this acte, as to euery felow and poore persone, hauing yearely reliefe out of any of the saide colleges, free chappelles, or chauntryes beinge within the limittes of theire commission. suche seueral yerely annuities, pencyons, or other recompenses, during their seueral liues, as to the same cōmissioners, or two of them shall bee thoughte meete and conuenyente. And ouer that the saide commissioners, or twoe of them at the least, shall haue full power and aucthoritie by vertue of this acte, and of the commissyon to them directed, to inquire, and trye by suche waies and meanes as they shall thinke meete and conuenient, what moneye, profyte and benefyte any poore persone, or persones by vertue of anye conueighance, assuraunce, composicion, wil deuise, or otherwise, heretofore
had or made, intended or meant to haue continuance for euer, had, or enioyed, wythin fiue yeres, next before the beginning of thys presente parliament out of any college, free chappelle, or chauntry, & other ye premisses geuen; limitted, or appointed to the king by this act, being within the limittes of their commission. And therupon to make assignemēts and orders in suche maner and fourme, as al and synguler suche fayde money, profite and commoditie shal bee paied to poore people for euer: Accordyng to suche saide assurance, composicyon, wyl, deuise, or other thyng had; or made, for the same, and to assigne and appoint, lands, tenementes or other hereditaments, parcel of the premisses for the maintenaunce and continuaunce of the same for euer, and also to appoint to fraternityes, brotherheddes, and guildes, landes, tenementes, & heredytamentes parcell of the premisses towardes and for the mayntenāce of piers, iutties, walles, or bankes, against the rages of the sea, hauens and creekes. And that all and singuler annuityes, pencions, and other recompences, shalbe halfe yerely payed to ye persons, to whom the same ought to be payed by the kynges Receyuour for the time being, of hys landes commonly called the suppressed lands, or other his reuenues, lying in the countie or citye, where such colledge, free chappel, or chaūtry or other the premisses geuen, limitted or appointed to the king, by thys act, the first day of this present parliament, were or remained without any fee, or rewarde therfore to be paied: The first payment to begin at the feaste of saint Michaell the Archaungell nexte comming. And that euery suche receiuour, vpon his accompt, shall haue full and due allowaunce of all suche annuities, pencions; & other recompences by him paied, by vertue of any such assignement to be made, by the said commissioners or two of them at the least.

And it is ordeyned and enacted by the aucthority of this present parliament, that the said commissioners, and euery of them, that shall take vpon him ye execuciō of any of the said commissions, shalbe bound, as he wil answer before God, to execute the cōmissiō, to him & other directed beneficially towards the deanes, maisters, wardens, prouosts, & other incumbents, and ministers aforesaide, and towardes the poore people, concerning the said assygnements, and also toward the maintenance of piers, iutties, walles, or bankes, againste the rages of the sea, hauens & creekes: And that al maner of assignements & ordinaunces to be made by the said commissioners, or two of thē at the least and certified vnder their seales or the seales of two of thē at the least, into ye kinges courte of the augmentacyons & reuenues of his crowne, or to any other court or courtes, by the kinges maiesty to be made or assigned, shal by vertue of this acte, and of the saide commissioners, bee as good and effectuall in the law to al intēts, cōstructions and purposes, as thoughe the same had ben assigned and ordeined by aucthoritie of this present parliamēt by expresse and apte wordes, termes, and sentences.

Prouided also, that such annuities, pencions, or other recompences, that the saide commissioners, or any of them, shall assigne or appoynt to be paide yerely to any such deane master, warden, gouernour: or other incumbent, felow, or minister, shall not extend to any more clere yerely value, then suche deane, master, warden, prouost, gouernor or other incumbent, felow, or minister, or his predecessor lawfully had, or enioyed in money, meate, drink, liuerie, or allowance of the same yerely, within fiue yeres, next before the beginning of this present parliament,

Prouided also, that if any of the said maisters, wardēs, prouosts, gouernors, or other incumbēts, felow, or ministers, shal at any time hereafter, during his life, be promoted by the king to any benefice, or other spiritual promocion, being of a better clere yerely value then hys sayde annuitie or pencion, or other recōpence shalbe of: that then thannuitie, penciō, or other recōpence, that any such deane, master, warden, gouernor, prouost, or other incūbent, felow, minister, yt so shalbe {pro}moted shal haue, shal īmediatly after such {pro}mociō had, cease, & vtterly determine.

And be it ordeined & enacted by thaucthoritie of this presesent parliament, that the said commissioners, or two of them at the least, to whō any cōmission by vertue or meane of this act, shalbe directed & delyuered shalbe bounden vpon the forfaiture, of euery of them of a hundreth pound, to make certificat vnder their seales, or the seales of two of thē at the least into the saide court of the augmentacions, and reuenues of ye kings crowne, or into any other court, as is aforesaid, wtin one yeare next after the commission to them directed, of al manours, lands, tenements, tents, tithes, porcions, pencions, heredytaments, & recompēces by the same commissioners or two of them, assigned or appointed to any of the vses, intents, or purposes aboue mencioned.

And also be it ordeined & enacted, by thaucthority of this presēt parliament, that our souereigne lorde the king shall haue & enioy all suche goods, cattels, iuels, plate, ornaments, & other moueables, as were or be the common goods of euery such college, chauntrye, freechappell, or stipendarie prist, belonginge or annexed to the furniture or seruices of their seueral foundations, or abused of any of the saide corporaciōs, in the abuses aforesaid, ye propertie wherof was not altered nor chaūged before the .viii. day of December in ye yere of our lord god M.D.xlvii.

And it is also ordeined & enacted by thaucthoritie of this presēt parliament, that al suche debtes and sūmes of money, as ought, or shoulde without fraude or couin hereafter be paied of the moneye or goods of any of ye said colleges, due, or paiable, by reason of any cōtract, specialty or promise, had or made, before the same .viii. day, shal truely & fully be paied by ye treasorer of the kings court of thaugmentaciōs & reuenues of his crown, or by the tresorer or receiuer of any other court, to which any of the premisses shalbe appointed of the kinges treasure, beinge in his or their handes, with as conueniēt spede, as the same may be paid

Prouided alwayes, and be it ordeyned and enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaid, thac this acte, or any article, clause, or matter conteyned in the same, shal not in any wise extēde to any College, Hostoll, or Halle, being within eyther of the vniuersities of Cambrige and Oxforde, nor to any Chauntrie founded in any of the Colleges, Hostelles, or Halles, beinge in the same Vniuersities, nor to the free chappell of Sainct George, the Martire, situate in the Castle of Windesore, nor to the College, called sainct Mary College of Winchester, besides Winchester, of the foundation of Bishoppe Wikham, nor to the College of Eton, nor to the parish churche, commonly called the Chapel in the sea in Newton, within the Isle of Ely, in the countie of Cambrige, nor to anye Manours, landes, tenementes or hereditamentes, to them, or to anye of them pertaining, or belonging, nor to anye Chappel made or ordeined, for the ease of the people, dwelling distaunt from the parish churche, or suche like chappel, whereunto no more landes or tenementes, then the churchyarde, or a litle house or close, doth belong or perteine, nor to any cathedral church or College, where a Bishoppes sea is within thys realme of Englande, or in Wales, nor to the Manoures, landes, tenementes, or other hereditamentes of any of them, other then to such Chauntries, Obites, Lightes and Lampes, or any of them, as at any tyme within fiue yeres next before the begynning of thys present parlament, haue been hadde, vsed, or maintened, within the saide cathedrall churches, or within any of them, or the issues, reuenues, or profites of any of the said cathedral Churchs, to whiche Chauntries, Obites, lightes and lampes, it is enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaide, that thys acte shall extende.

And it is ordeyned & enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, that oure soueraigne lord the kyng at any tyme, during hys lyfe (whiche God lōg preserue, maye at hys will and pleasure, alter and chaunge the name or names, of all and singular Chauntries, and the Foundations of the same, being in any of the Colleges, Hostelles, or halles, of any of the sayde Vniuersities, according as to hys godly, wisedome shalbe thought mete and conuenient.

Sauing to all and euery persone and persons, bodies politike and corporate, theire heires and successours, and the heires and successoures of euerye of them, other then the Maisters, wardens, Ministers, Gouernoures, Rulers, Priestes, Incumbentes, Felowes, and brethren of the saide Colleges, Chauntries, freechappels, and other the premisses, geuē limitted, or appointed to the kyng by thys acte: & the successours of thē, and euery of them, and other then such as bee, or pretende to bee, foundoures, patrones, or donours of the premisses, or any of them, or of anye part or parcell therof, and the heires, successours and assignes of euery, or any of them: and other then such as bee, or were feoffees, recoueries, conisies, grauntees, or deuisees of any of the premisses, to, or for any of ye vses, purposes, or ententes aboue mentioned, or to the vse of anye of the
sayd Colleges, Free chappels, chauntries, or other the premisses, geuen, limitted, or appointed by thys act to the kyng, or to the entēt to employe the rentes or profites thereof, to the vse of Maisters, Rulers, Incumbentes, or Ministers of them, or any of them: and other then suche persone and persones, and bodies politike and corporate, theire heires, successours, and assignes, as claime or pretende, to haue estate, right, title, interest, vse, possession, or condition, of, in, or to the premisses, or any part or parcel thereof, by reason of anye feoffement, fine, bargain and sale, or by any other wayes, meanes, or conueighaunce to them made, of any estate of enheritaunce, without the saide late kynges licence, assent, consent, or agreement, and without the licence, assent, or agrement, of ye kinges Maiestie that nowe is, by any of the saide Deanes, maisters, Wardeines, ministers, gouernours, rulers, priests, or incumbentes, or by the Foundours, donours, or patrones of them, or of anye of them, all suche righte, title, clayme, possession, interest, rentes, annuities, commodities, commons, offices, fees, leases, liueries, liuinges, pencions, portions, debtes, dueties, and other profites, which they, or any of thē lawfully haue, or of right ought to haue, or might haue had, in, of, or to anye of the premisses, or in, of, or to any part or parcel therof, in such like maner, fourme and condition, to all ententes, respectes, constructions, and purposes, as if this act had neuer been had nor made, and as though the said Chauntries, colleges, and other the sayde promotions, had still continued and remained in their full being: and sauing to all and euerye Patrone, donour, foundour, or gouernour of any such college, Chauntrie, free chappel, Stipendary priestes, and other the premisses, geuen, limitted, or appointed to the kyng by thys act, and the donour, feoffoure, and geuer of the aforesaide landes, tenementes, or hereditamentes, to them, or anye of them, or to anye vses, or purposes before mentioned, all suche rentes, seruices, rentes secke, rentes charge, fees, annuities, profits, and offices: and also lease for terme of life, lyues, and yeres, whereupon the accustomed rent, or more, is reserued, as they, or any of them lawfully had, perceiued, and enioyed, in, out, or of any the sayd promotions, or out of any of the sayde landes, tenementes, or hereditamentes, before the first day of thys present parlament.

And ouer that, it is ordeined and enacted by the aucthoritie of thys present parlament, that all and euery persone and persons, beinge in life, which haue, or hath for any sōme of money to him or thē, payed, bargained, or solde, any Manours, landes, tenementes, or other hereditamentes aforesaide, whereunto the kyng our souereigne lord is intituled, by vertue of thys acte, shall repaye to suche persone, as so bought any of the sayde Manoures, Landes, Tenementes, or other Hereditamentes, or to hys Executours or assignes, vpon a request therfore made, or within three Monethes, then nexte ensuing the same requeste, as much money, as he, or they receiued, for the sale of any thing, so by hym or them solde,
And for none payment therof, such persone and persones as purchased, or bought the sayde landes, tenementes, and other the premisses, or any parcell therof, and their executours and administratours, shalbee enhabled by thauctoritie of thys present parlament, to sue, and maintain an action of debt at the common lawes of thys realme, against such person or persones, as so bargained or solde to hym or thē, or to their testatour anye of the premisses, belonging to any college, chauntrie, free chapel, or other promotion spirituall, in which action of debte, none essoine, protection, or wager of lawe shalbe admitted or allowed.

And bee it further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, that all, and euery of the saide chauntries, colleges, & freechapels, and other the premisses, geuen, limitted, or appointed to the kyng by thys acre, and all the mansion houses, manours, landes, tenementes, possessions, and hereditamentes, and other the premisses whatsoeuer they be, geuen, limitted, & appointed to the kyng by thys acte, and euery parte and parcell of thē whiche by aucthoritie and vertue of thys acte, been vested, adiudged, & demed, or shalbe in the kynges maiesties possession & handes, or whiche the kyng shalbe entitled vnto, by vertue of thys acte, shalbe in the order, suruaye and gouernaunce of our souerein lord the kynges courte of the Augmentations and reuenues of his crowne, or in suche other court as the kyng at anye time hereafter shall assigne, name, or appoincte, and so shall, and may be graunted, letten, and sette to the farme by the Chauncellour, officers, and ministres of the same courte, or of any other courte so to bee appointed, in suche maner and fourme, as other manoures, landes, tenementes, appointed to the same courte of Augmentations, and reuenues of hys graces Crowne, or other court so to be appointed, ben to bee graunted or letten: And that all the farmes, issues, reuenues and profites, comming & growing of the same premisses, and of euerye parte thereof, shalbe taken and receiued to the kynges vse, by the officers and ministers of the same court or courtes, in such maner and fourme, as is vsed and had of other manours, landes, and tenements, & of the issues, reuenues, and profits of the same, committed to the order, rule, suruay, and gouernance of the sayd court of the Augmentations and reuenues of the kyngs crowne, or any other court so to bee appointed: any act, statute, ordinaunce, custome, or vse, heretofore had, made, or vsed, to the cōtrary notwithstanding.

And it is further enacted by aucthoritie aforesayde, that if any of the saide Maisters, Wardeins, Ministers, Rulers, Gouernours, Priestes, Incumbentes, or owners of any suche college, chauntrie, free chappell, or of any the premisses, geuen, limitted, or appointed to the kyng by this acte, or of any of them, sithens the xxiii. day of Nouembre, in the xxxvii. yere of the reigne of ye said late kyng, haue made any lease, vnder hys or theire common Seale, or otherwise, for terme of yeres, lyfe, or lyues, of theire sayde colleges, chauntries, freechapels, or of other the same premisses,
or of any part thereof, or of any Manours, Landes, Tenements, possessions, or hereditamentes, whatsoeuer they be, to them, or to any of them, vnited, or annexed, belonging, or appertaininge, vpon the whiche leasses, the vsual and olde rentes and fermes, accustomed to bee yelden and reserued, or more, by the space of xx. yeres next before the saide xxiii. daye of Nouembre, not reserued and yelden, shalbe vtterly voide and of none effecte: and that all other leasses and grauntes, heretofore made of any the premisses, geuen, limitted, or appointed to the kynge by thys acte, shalbe as good, auaileable, and effectual in the law, to all intentes, constructions, and purposes, as if this act had neuer been had, or made, any thing in this act, or any other act hertofore had or made, to the contrary thereof, in anye wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, & be it further ordeined & enacted by the auctoritie aforesayd, that thys acte, or any thing therein conteined, shall not extende to anye manours, lands, tenementes, possessions, or hereditamentes, whiche the saide Maistres, wardeins, Ministres, Chauntrie priestes, Incumbentes, or other the sayde Gouernours, Officers, ministers, or rulers of the premisses, or of anye of them, hath, or is, or hereafter shal haue, or bee possessed, or seased of in fee simple, fee taile general or special for terme of lyfe, terme of yeres, or otherwise, to hys or theire owne propre vses, by enheritaunce, or purchase: and not beinge at anye time vnited, or annexed, to hys or theire saide Colleges, Free chappels, Chauntries, or other the premisses, geuen, limitted, or appointed to the kynge by thys acte: nor shall extende to anye Manoures, landes, tenementes, possessions, rentes, annuities, and yerelye pencion, or pencions, or to any yerelye summe, or summes of money, being not vnited, or parcell of any the sayde Colleges, and other the premisses aforesayde, or of anye of thē heretofore geuen or graunted by the saide late kyng, or geuen or graunted, or herafter to be geuen or graūted by the kyng our souereigne lord, to any of the said Deanes, Maisters, wardeins, Ministers, Chauntrie priestes, Incumbentes, gouernours, or rulers of the premisses, or of any of them, for terme of lyfe onely, vnder hys greate Seale of England, or vnder the Seale of the Courte of the Augmentations, and reuenues of the kynges crowne, or any other of the kynges seales, of any of hys courtes: any thing conteined in thys act, to the cōtrary in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alway, and bee it enacted by aucthoritie aforesayde, that aswel, all and euery patrone, Donour, Foundour, and geuer of any of the saide promotions, or premisses, or geuer, donour, or Feoffer, of any their Landes, Tenementes, Possessions, or other hereditamentes, as all and euerye persone and persones, bodies politike and corporate, whiche before the making of thys Acte, lawfullye without fraude or couine, had, or enioyed, any maner of rent, or other yerely profites, to bee taken, perceiued, or had, of any Chauntries, colleges, free chappelles, or other the
premisses, geuen, limitted, or appointed to the kyng by thys acte, or oute of anye Manours, Landes, Tenementes, or other possessions of them, or any of them shall haue and enioy the same, in like maner and fourme, as they should and ought to haue doen, if the saide colleges, chauntries, free chappelles, and other the premisses geuen, limitted, or appointed to the kynge by thys acte, had still remained and continued in esse, and full being: any thing in thys act mentioned to the contrary in anye wise notwithstanding.

Prouided also, and bee it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, that yf anye suche gouernour, ruler, wardein, maister, incumbent, minister, or other hauing any of the said spiritual promotions, or incumbentes, haue, or shal compounde for the first fruites of any such spiritual promotions, accordinge to the lawes and statutes of thys Realme, and the dayes of payment of any part therof, not expired before the first day of thys parlament, that all summes of money so to bee due and payable sithens the sayd first daye of thys parlament, shall ceasse, and bee not payd, asked, or demaūded: any bonde, recognisaunce, suertie, or other thing had, or made to the contrary notwithstanding.

Prouided always, & be it enacted by the auctoritie aforesayd, that all suche rentes, seruices, issues, profites, and other summes of money payable out, of, or for any of the premisses, or any of thē, in the kyngs courte of hys Excheker, shall continue, and be continually and yerelye leuied, charged, or paied in the same courte, in suche maner and fourme, as hertofore hath ben vsed: any lawe, custome, vnitie of possession in the kynges hyghnesse, or other thing to the contrary notwithstanding: And as though the said promotions, Manours, landes, tenementes, and other the premisses had not come to the kyngs handes or possession.

And be it further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayde, that all and euery letters patentes made by the said late king Henry the eight, or by the kyng • maiestie that now is, or herafter to be made by hys hyghnes, to any persone or persones, or to any archbishoppe, or bishoppe, of any of the saide colleges, chauntries, free chappelles, or other the premisses, or any part or parcel of them, or of any landes, tenements or hereditamentes, belonging or appertaining, or that did belong, or apperteine to thē, or to anye of them: And all fines, giftes, grauntes, feoffements, recoueries, and all other assurances and conueighaunces therof had or made, by the assent, consent, or licence, vnder the great Seale of Englande, of the sayde late kynge Henrye the eighte, or of the kynges Maiestie that now is, to anye persone or persones, bodies politike or corporate, by any Chauntrie priest, Maister, wardein, minister, ruler, gouernour, or other hauinge anye of the sayde promotions, of anye of the sayde Colleges, chauntries, free chappels, or other the premisses, or of any of them, or of any part, parcell, or membre of the same, shall stande and bee in their forces, and effectes, and shalbee good and effectual in the lawe, for suche
estatutes and interestes, geuen, graunted, limitted, or appointed in any of the gyftes, grauntes, assurances, or conueighances therof had or made, according to their purportes, fourme & maner, and according to the true entent and meaning of the same assurances, and shalbee by aucthoritie of thys acte, good, parfite, and auaileable, aswel against the kynge, hys heires and successours, as against the saide chauntrie priestes, wardeins, maisters, rulers, gouernours, and other hauing any of the sayde promotions, and their successours, and the successours of euery of them: as also against the foundours, donours, and patrones of the same, & the ordinary of them, and euery of them, and the heires and successoures of euery of them: any lawe, statute, ordinaunce, or other thing, to the contrary thereof notwithstanding.

And where diuers and sundrye Bishoppes, Deanes, Archedeacones, Treasaurours, Prebendaries, Chauntrie priestes, maisters, prouostes, Rulers, Gouernours of anye Deaneries, Archedeaneries, Treasaurorshippes, Prebendes, freechappels, Chauntries, or Colleges, within this realme of England, and other the kyngs Maiesties dominions, or any of the patrones, foundours, donours of any of the Bishoprickes, Treasaurourshippes, Deaneries, Chauntries, free chappels, or other the said Spiritual promotions, of their voluntary willes or mindes, for diuers good and reasonable causes and considerations, by deede or deedes enrolled, or by other writinges, or conueighaunces heretofore geuen and graunted to the late king of famous memory Henry the eight, late king of Englād, & to hys heyrs, or to our souereigne lord the kyng that now is, and to hys heires, diuers of their Deaneries, Archedeaneries, Treasaurorshippes, Prebendes, Chappelles, Chauntries, & colleges, or anye other ecclesiasticall or spirituall promotions last before remembred and all, or some part of the Manoures, landes, tenementes, tithes, pencions, annuities, rentes, reuertions, and other reuenues, hereditamentes, possessions, emolumentes and profites, to the same Bishoprickes, deaneries, colleges, and other like promotions, benefices, offices, & dignities, or to any of them belonging, apperteining, vnited, or annexed, or whiche the saide bishoppes, deanes, archedeacons, treasaurors, chauntrie priestes, maisters, prouostes, rulers, gouernours, and other Ecclesiasticall, or spiritual officers or ministers, or any of the said patrones, donours, or foundours, or any of them had, or enioyed in the right, or by reason of any of the same promotions, offices, or dignities.

Be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaide, that all and euery gyftes, and grauntes heretofore made to the said late kyng, and to hys heires, or to our souereigne lord the kyng that now is, and to hys heirs, by any Archebishoppe, Bishoppe, Deane, Archedeacon, Treasaurour, Prebendary, Maister, Prouost, gouernoure, or other the saide Ecclesiasticall or spiritual persone or persons, or by any patrones, donour, or foundour of
any of the said Deaneries, Chauntries, or other of the sayd spiritual, or Ecclesiastical promotions, or of all, or any of the manours, landes, tenementes, tithes, rentes, reuersions, pencions, portiōs, annuities, or other hereditamentes, reuenues, emolumentes, profites, or commodities, to any of the said benefices, offices, prebendes, promotions, or dignities belonging, apperteining, vnited, or annexed, or whiche any of the same archebishoppes, Bishoppes, Deanes, Archedeacons, Treasaurours, Masters, Prouostes, Prebendaries, Rulers, Gouernours, Officers, or Ministers, Patrones, Foundours, or Donours, had, or enioyed, or haue, or enioye, or ought to haue or enioye, in the righte, or by reason, or meanes of any of the same promotions, offices, or dignities, shalbe good & effectuall in the lawe, to all intentes and purposes: Sauing to all and euery persone and persones, and bodies politike and corporate, theire heires, successours, and assignes, and to the heires, successours, and assignes of euery of them, other then the Archebishops, Bishops, Deanes, Archdeacons, treasaurours, prebendaries, rulers, gouernoures, wardeines, prouostes, geuours, and grauntours of any of the premisses, & their heires, successours, and assignes, and other then suche ecclesiasticall, or spirituall persones, bodies politike or corporate, as are, or pretende to bee foundours, donours, patrons, or ordinaries of the premisses, or any of them, all such rightes, titles, interestes, claimes, entrees, rentes, reuersions, remainders, fees, offices, annuities, landes, tenementes, hereditamentes, profites, commodities, and emolumentes, as they or any of them haue, or should, or ought to haue had, of, in, or to the premisses next aboue mētioned, or any part therof, as if this act had neuer ben had, or made, any thing in thys act to the contrary in anye wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, that thys acte, or any thing therin conteined, shall not in any wise extende to make good or effectuall, any gyft, graunt, bargain, sale, or alienation made by anye person, or Vicare of theire Personages, or Vicarages, or of any part or parcell thereof, or of any thing to them, or any of them belonging or apperteining.

Prouided also, that thys acte, or any thing therein conteined, shall not in any wise extende, to hinder or preiudice George Brooke knight, lord Cobhā, his heires, or assignes, for, or cōcerninge the late college of Cobham, in the Countie of Kente, or the Manours, landes, tenementes, or possessions therof: any thing aboue mentioned to ye contrary, in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided also, and be it enacted, by the aucthoritie aforesaid, that this present acte, or any thing therein conteined, shall in any wise extende, or be preiudicial or hurtful to the general corporatiō of any citie, borough, or Towne, within thys realme, or anye other the kynges dominiōs, ne shall extende to anye the landes, or hereditamentes, of them, or anye of them: Any thing herein conteined, to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided also, and be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaide, that all suche of the saide colleges, free chappels, chauntries, and other the premisses, being appointed and geuen to the kyngs hyghnesse, by the auctoritie of thys act, as be within the Duchie of Lancaster, & all manoures, Landes, Tenementes, and hereditamentes, perteining or belonging to the same colleges, free chappels, and chauntries, shall after the said feast of Easter nexte comming, be within the surueye & order of the courte of the Duchie of Lancastre, in suche maner and fourme, as other the premisses bee assigned or appointed by aucthoritie of thys acte, to be in the surueye and order of the Court of the Augmentations and reuenues of the kynges crowne, or other court by the kyng to be assigned: and that all commissions, that hereafter shalbe awarded by vertue & force of this acte, concerning suche colleges, free chappels, chauntries, and other the premisses, as bee within the said Duchie of Lancastre, shalbe awarded vnder the great seale of England, & shalbe certified into the same courte of the Duchie of Lancastre: any thing abouesaid to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, & bee it enacted by the auctoritie aforesayde, that this acte, ne any thing therein conteined, shall extende to the College, or chauntrie of Attylbourghe in the countie of Norffolke, which the sayde late king Henry the eight gaue to Robart, late Earle of Sussex, & to his heirs: but that Henry now Earle of Sussex, sonne and heire to the said late Erle, hys heires and assignes, shall, & maye, by thauctoritie of thys acte, haue and enioy the sayde college, and chauntrie, and all Manours, Landes, Tenementes, aduowsons, tithes, pencions, portions, and other hereditaments thereunto belonging or appertaining: any thing in this acte, to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided always, and by the auctoritie aforesaide, bee it enacted, that the kynges Maiestie, at any tyme, when it shal seeme to hym good, may geue auctoritie to certain hys graces commissioners, to alter the nature and condition of all maner of Obites, aswell within the vniuersities of Cambridge and Oxforde, as in any other place, within thys hys graces realme of Englande and Wales, being not suppressed ne annichilate by vertue of thys present acte, and the same Obites so altered, to dispose to a better vse, as to the reliefe of some poore men being studētes, or otherwise.

Prouided also, and be it enacted by aucthoritie aforesaide, that it shal not be lefull to any persone or persones, bodies politike or corporate, by reason of anye remainder, vse, or condition, to enter into, clayme, or challenge any landes, tenementes, or hereditamentes, for the none doynge, not naming, or none finding of anye suche priest or priestes, or poore folkes, as is aforesaide, obite, anniuersary, light or lampe, from henceforth to be founden or doen: any thing herein conteined, to the cōtrary in any wise notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, that thys act, nor any thing therein cōteined, shal in any wise extende to any landes, tenementes, possessions, or hereditamentes whatsoeuer, that any maister, Deane, Prebendary, wardein, or chauntrie, or any Stipendary priest of any college, chauntrie, prebende, fraternitie, guylde, or any other corporations haue, or helde of any persone or persones, by copie of courte rolle, or at will, according to the custome of any manour or manours: nor geue or graunt any copyhold landes to the kynges hyghnesse.

And also prouided, that the kynges highnes, his heires, or successours, shall not in any wise haue, holde, enioy, or take by vertue of thys acte, or any article therin conteined, any maner of copyhold, landes, tenements, possessions, or hereditamentes whatsoeuer they be: but that all & euery of the saide persones and incumbentes shall haue, holde, and enioye the same, during their liues, towardes their pencion and yerely liuing, paying the rentes, and doing their customes and seruices thereof due & accustomed: any thing in thys acte, to the contrary notwithstanding.

Prouided, that thys act shall not extende to any landes, tenementes, or hereditamentes assigned, appointed, or intended for the findinge, or maintenaunce of anye chauntrie priest, or stipendary priest, whiche by any former right, and good title, without fraude or couine, were lawfully recouered from the possession of any such chauntrie priest, or stipendarie priest, before the first day of Octobre: the saide xxxvii. yere of the reigne of the said late kyng Henry the eight, whiche landes, tenementes, & hereditamentes were not charged, nor chargeable to the paiment of the perpetual tenthe: any thing in thys act, to the contrary hereof notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, and be it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaid, that all and singular grauntes, licences, confirmations, & letters Patentes, whiche our late souereigne lord kyng Henry the eight, or our souereign lord the kyng that now is, haue made vnder the great seale of England to any persone or persones, bodies politike or corporate, of anye college, chappel, or chauntrie nowe being in esse, or standing, or now not beinge in esse, or not standing, or of any lordshippes, manours, landes, tenementes, and hereditamentes, annexed, vnited, belonging, or apperteining to any college, chappell, or chauntrie now being in esse, or standing, or now not being in esse, or not standing, or of anye other thing or thinges mentioned, expressed, or conteined in any such graunt, licence, confirmation, or letters patentes, shall from henceforth bee demed, taken, expouned, & adiudged good and effectual in the lawe, according to the wordes, sentences, meaninges, ententes, fourme, and effectes of the same grauntes, licences, confirmations, and letters patentes, to all intentes, constructions, and purposes, as if thys acte, and the sayde acte made in the sayde xxxvii. yere of the said late kyng Henry the eight, had neuer ben had, nor
made. And that thys act, or the said act made in the sayde xxxvii. yere of the reigne of our said late souereigne lord kyng Henry the eight, or any clause, article, sentence, or other thing therein conteined, shal not extend to any Colleges, Chappels, Chauntries, or other thing or thinges mentioned in this act, now being in esse, or stāding, or now not being in esse, or not standing, or to any manours, lands, tenementes, possessions, reuenues, or hereditaments, annexed, vnited, belonging, or apperteininge to any College, Chappell, Chauntrie, or other thing mentioned in this act now being in esse or standing, or now not being in esse, or not standing, or to anye other thing or thinges, mentioned, or expressed in thys Acte: whiche any persone or persones, bodies politike or corporate haue had, or obteined, by the assent, licence, cōfirmation, graunt, or letters Patentes of the said late kyng, or of the kyngs Maiestie that now is: nor shall extende to any Manours, Landes, Tenementes, Reuenues, possessiōs, hereditamentes, or other thing or thinges, mentioned, expressed, or conteined in any such licence, confirmation, graunt, or letters patentes: but that euerye suche persone and persones, bodies politike and corporate, their heires & successours and assignes, and the heires, successoures, and assignes of euery of them, shall haue, holde, and enioy, all and euerye the same colleges, chappels, Chauntries, Manours, landes, Tenementes, Reuenues, Possessions, and Hereditamentes, and all and euerye other thing and things whatsoeuer, so by them had or obteined, by the assent, licence, confirmation, graunte, or letters Patentes of the sayde late kyng, or of the kynges Maiestie that now is, according to the woordes, sentences, fourme, effecte, meaning, and entent of the same lycences, confirmations, grauntes, and Letters Patentes: thys acte, or the sayde acte made in the sayd xxxvii. yere of the reigne of the said late kyng Henry the eight, or any clause, article, sentence, matter, or thing mencioned, expressed, or conteined in any of the same actes, to the contrary thereof in any wise notwithstanding.

div.head: ¶ An acte concerning the kyngs most gratious generall Pardone. ¶ The .xv. Chapiter.
div.p:
THe kynges moste Royal Maiestie right well perceiuing hys louing subiects by many and sundry waies and meanes, to haue borne & susteined the great aduentures, charges, and businesse of warres, & desences of thys hys realme, aswel in the tyme of his most dere father kyng Henry the eight, as in his time and reigne, entending of hys clemēcie and pity to gratify hys sayd subiects with his gratious free and liberal pardon, according to hys kyngly power, trusting assuredly that his said subiectes will cōtinue hys louing & assured obediēt subiects, & hereafter in such sort obey hys hyghnesse lawes & statutes, as to thē, and euery of thē of right apperteineth: is fully and resolutelye contented & pleased, that it bee enacted by aucthoritie of thys present parlament, in maner & fourme folowing, that is to say, that all and euerye of hys said subiects, aswell spirituall as temporall, of thys hys realme of Englande, Wales, the Isles of Iernesey and Garnesey, Barwicke, Caleis, Guisnes, Hammes, Bulleyn, and Bull • noys, and the marches of the same, the heires, successours, executours, and administratours of them and euery of thē, and all and singular bodies in any maner of wise corporate, Cities, Boroughes, Shires, Ridinges, Hundredes, Lathes, Wapentakes, Townes, Villages, and Tithings, and euery of them, and the successour and successoures of euerye of them, shalbe by the aucthoritie of thys present Parlamente, acquited, pardoned, released and discharged againste the kynges hyghenes, hys heires, successoures, and executours, and euerye of them, of all maner of Treasons, Heresies, Felonies, Robberies, offences, Contemptes, Trespasses, wronges, deceiptes, misdemeanours, forfeitures, penalties, and profites, summes of money, peines of death, peines corporall and pecuniarie, and all other thinges, causes, quereles, sutes, iudgementes, and executions, which may be, or can be by hys hyghnesse in anye wise, or by any meane pardoned, before, and vnto the xxv. daye of Decembre, in the yere of our Lord God a M.CCCCC.xlvii. Other then suche as hereafter in thys acte bee excepted or foreprised, in such maner and fourme, and vnto such times as they be excepted or forprised in thys act: and other then such as the clauses or prouisos hereafter mentioned, doth extende vnto. And also the kinges hyghnesse is further contented and pleased, that it bee enacted by the aucthoritie of this present Parlament, that thys hys said free pardone shalbe as good and effectuall in the lawe, to euery of hys sayde subiectes, bodies corporate, and other before rehearsed, and to euerye of them, by the saide generall
wordes before rehearsed in all thinges, which bee not hereafter in thys present act excepted or forprised, as the same pardon shoulde haue been, if all offences, contemptes, forfeitures, causes, matters, sutes, querelles, iudgementes, executions, penalties, and all other thinges not hereafter excepted, nor conteined in any clause of prouiso herafter mentioned, had been, particularly, singularly, specially, and plainely named, rehearsed, & specified, and also pardoned by propre and expresse wordes and names, in their kyndes, natures, and qualities, by wordes and termes thereūto requisite, to haue ben put in, and expressed in thys present act of free pardone: and that hys sayd subiectes, nor any of them, nor the heires, executours or administratours of any of them, nor any of the said bodies corporate, nor any other persons, bodies politike or corporat before named, or anye of them, bee, nor shalbe sued, vexed, or inquieted in their bodies, goodes, landes, or cattalles, for any maner matter, cause, contempt, misdemeanour, forfeiture, trespasse, offence, or any other thing, suffred, doen or cōmitted against his hyghnes, his crown, dignitie, prerogatiue, lawe or statutes, but onely for suche matters, causes, and offences, as bee rehearsed in the exceptions and clauses of prouiso, in thys present act herafter mentioned, in suche maner and fourme as in the same exceptiōs & clauses of prouiso be mentioned, and for none other: any statute or statutes, lawes, customes, vses, or president heretofore had, made, or vsed, to the contrarye in any wise notwithstanding.

Also the kynges hyghnesse, of hys bounteous liberalitie, by auctoritie of thys present parlament, graunteth and freely geueth to euery of hys sayde subiectes, and to euerye of the said bodies corporate and other before rehearsed, and to euery of them, all suche goodes, cattalles, debtes, fines, issues, profites, amerciamentes, forfeitures and summes of money by anye of them forfeicted, which to hys hyghnes doe, or shoulde belong or appertain by reason of any offence, contēpt, trespasse, misdemeanour, matter, cause, or querele suffred, doen or committed by them, or anye of them, whiche be not hereafter foreprised or excepted in thys present act. And that all and euery the kynges sayde subiectes, and all and singuler bodies corporate, and other before rehearsed, maye by hym or themselfe, or by hys or their deputie or deputies, or by hys or their attorney, or attorneyes, accordinge to the lawes of thys Realme, pleade and minister thys present act of free pardon for hys or their discharge, of, & for euerye thing, that is by vertue of this present act pardoned, discharged, geuen, or graunted without any fee or other thing, in any wise payinge to anye person or persons, for writing, or entrie of the iudgement, or other cause cōcerning such plee, writing or entrie, but onely xii. d. to bee payed to the officer or clerke that shall entre the plee, matter or iudgemēt, for the discharge of any of the partie so pleading the same: anye statute, or vse, to the contrary in any wise notwithstanding.

And furthermore, the kyngs hyghnesse is contented and pleased, that
it be enacted, by the aucthoritie of thys present parlament, that his sayd free pardone, by the general woordes before rehearsed, shalbe reputed, demed, and adiudged, allowed, and taken in all maner of courtes, & els where, aswell in the woordes and clauses of exceptions and foreprises specified in thys present act, as in all and singuler other clauses, words, and sentences, mentioned and rehearsed in thys hys sayde free pardone most beneficially and auaileably, to all and singular hys saide subiectes, bodies corporate, and other before rehearsed, and to euery of thē, in all thinges ambiguous, or doubtfull, and moste strongly in Barre, and discharge against hys hyghnesse, hys heires, successoures, and executours, in euery thing, without any obstacle, challenge, or other delay, whatsoeuer it shalbe, to be made, pleaded, obiected, or alleged by ye king our souereigne lord, his heirs, successours, or executours, or by his, or any of their general attorney, or atturneys, or by any persone or persons, for hys hyghenes, or any of hys heires, successours, or executours.

And furthermore, it is enacted by the kyng our Souereigne Lord, by aucthoritie of this present parlament, that yf any officer or clerke, of any of hys hyghnesse courtes, commonly called the kynges benche, Chauncery, & Common place, or of hys Excheker, or any other officer or clerke of any other court within thys realme, or in Wales, or other the kynges dominions aboue mentioned, at any tyme after the twentie daye of Ianuary next comminge, which shalbe in the yere of our Lorde God a. M.CCCCC.xlvii. make out, or write out any maner writtes, or other processe, or any extractes, sommons, or other preceptes, wherby anye of the sayde subiectes, or anie of the sayde bodies corporate, or other before rehearsed, or any of them, shalbe in any wise arrested, attached, distreined, sommoned, or otherwise vexed, inquieted, or grieued in his or theire bodies, landes, tenementes, goodes, or cattalles, or in any of thē, for, or because of any maner of thing pardoned or discharged, by vtue of this act of free pardone, he so offending, and therof lefully condēpned, shal yelde and paye for the recompence therof, to the partie so grieued or offended, treble damages, to bee accompted, as parcel of the damages and costes of the suite. And neuerthelesse, all and singular such writtes, processe, extractes and preceptes so to be made, for, or vpon any maner thing pardoned or discharged by thys presente acte of free pardone, shalbee vtterlye voide and of none effect.

Excepted alwayes and foreprised out of thys general and free pardō, all and all maner of hyghe Treasons, petit Treason, and misprision of Treason, doen, committed, or perpetrated, in any of the parties beyonde the sea, and all and all maner of Treason, doen, or committed in anye other place, by any persone or persones, by any ouert deede, whereby any bodily hurt or harme shal come, or be doen to the kynges onely persone, and all suites, punishementes, executions, forfeictures and penalties, for or by reason or occasion of anye of the same Treasons, before excepted.

And excepted all prepensed and voluntary murders, and also except al titles of actions, of Quare impedit, all rauishments, and withholding of the kyngs Wardes and Wardes landes, and the profites of the same at anye tyme growen to the kyngs handes, or to anye of hys noble progenitoures, and not yet discharged, all wastes of the kynges woodes, aswell in Parkes, Forestes, chases, and els where, and all summes of money graunted, or promised to be payed, by waye or meane of beneuolēce or contribution not payed and contented: and all and singuler debtes, other then debtes growen vpon Recognisaunces, being alreadye forfeited for suertie of the peace, good abearing, or for none apparaunce at any day or place. And excepted and forprised out of this pardon, all maner of accoumptes, and all actions, suites, and impetitions for the same, and all arrerages of accomptes and debtes due for the same. And also, excepted all homages, liueries, and reliefes, rentes, seruices, and arrerages of the same, not doen, or not paied. And also excepted al debtes, which wer due to the kyngs hyghnesse, or to the sayd late kyng of famous memory kyng Henry the eight, or to the late kyng Henry the vii. or to any person or persons, to the vse of the kyng our souereigne lord, or of hys saide father, or kyng Henry the vii. by anye condemnation, recognisaunce, obligatiō, or otherwise. And also excepted all and singuler forfeitures being due to our souereigne Lord the kyng, or to the sayde late kynge, by any penal statute or statutes, whiche be conuerted into the nature of debte, by iudgement, or by agreement of the offendour, and al forfeitures, and other penalties and profites, growen, or due by reason of any offence or acte committed or doen, contrary to any statute or statutes, or contrary to the common lawe, wherof any seisure is made, or any information is geuen in the kynges Excheker, or any suite there commensed, & now depending, and not yet determined: Or wherof the kynges hyghenesse, or his sayde father, by bill assigned, or otherwise, haue made any gift or assignement, to any of the seruaunts of our said souereigne lord the kyng, or of hys said father, or to any other persone or persones.

Also except and forprised out of thys free pardone, all and all maner of forgeing, counterfeycting, washing, and clipping of whatsoeuer moneye or coyne, currant in thys Realme, and the bringing into thys Realme of any false or counterfeict moneye or coigne, made, forged, or counterfeit out of this realme, and the vttering of any such false or counterfeict money or coyne, had, made, done, or perpetrated, sithen the xxvii. day of Ianuary last past, & all & all maner of offences, impetitions, punishements, forfeitures, peines of deathe, iudgementes, and execution for the same. And also, except and forprised out of thys free pardone, all and singular fines to be had, made, or payed, by reason or meane of anye alienation, had or made of any manours, landes, tenementes, or other hereditamētes without licence, sithen the sayde xxvii. day of Ianuary. Also excepte & forprised out of thys free pardon, all and all maner of manslaughters,
Burgularies, roberies, of any persone or persones, in any house, or nere anye hygh waye, and wilful burning of houses, and wilful burninge of Barnes, in whiche Barnes any corne was, at the time of such burning, and all maner of rauishmentes of any woman against her will; all felonious takyng of any money or goodes, out of any churche or chappel, al and all maner of felonious taking of any horse, gelding, or mare, and all maner of piracies and offences vpon the Sea, had, done, committed, or perpetrated, sithen the first day of August last past: and all maner of punishementes, impeticions, forfeitures, peines of deathe, Iudgementes, and executions for the same. And excepte and forprised out of thys free pardon, all, & all maner of intrusions, had, made, or doen, sithen the saide xxvii. day of Ianuary last past. And except and forprised out of this free pardone, all and all maner of deceytes and offences, of all and singular moniers, and other officers, ministers, & workemen, of, or in any of the Mintes within thys realme, and all impetitions and punishementes for the same. And except and forprised out of thys free Pardone, all and all maner of decaying of any mesuage, cotage, or house, and the conuerting of landes from tillage vnto pasture, contrary to any statute, heretofore had or made. And excepte and forprised the issues, reuenues, & profites of all and singular suche Mesuages, cotages, houses, and Landes, comming, arising, or growing, sithen the saide xxvii. daye of Ianuarye laste past. And except and forprised out of thys free pardone, all and singular collectours, or collectour of any Subsidie, fiftene, beneuolence, or contribution, and other persones whatsoeuer, that ought to be accomptaunt, and the heirs, executours, and administratours of euery of them, of, for, and concerninge all maner of debtes, accoumptes, and arrerages of accoumptes, & all maner of concelementes of customes and subsidies, and all maner of impetitions and suites for the same. And except & forprised out of thys free pardon, all and singular persones and persone, being the ii. daye of Decembre, in the yere of our Lord God M.D.xlvii. prisoners or prisoner, in the tower of London, & all and singular persons and persone, which at any time, before the ii. day of Decēbre, did flie out of thys realme, into the parties beyond the sea, for anye treason, or misprision of treason. And excepte and forprised out of this free pardone, all issues, fines, and amerciaments, affered, taxed, set, extracted, or entred seuerally or perticularly, extending to the somme of an C.s. or aboue. And that al and singular other fines, aswel fines pro licentia concordandi as other, and all other issues and amerciamentes, aswell reall as other, which seuerally or perticularly, extēd not to the same sōme of .C.s. whether they be totted or not totted, taken to the charge of the sherife, or not taken to his charge, extracted, or not extracted, whether they be torned into debt or not into debte, and not being leuied, nor receiued by any shirife or shirifes, bailife, ministers, or other officers, shalbe fully, clerely, and plainely pardoned, & discharged against the king our souereigne lord, hys heirs
and successours for euer, by thys present acte of free pardone.

And bee it further enacted by the aucthoritie aforesayd, that in case it be obiected, to, or against any Sherif or Sherifes, or other accomptantes in the kynges court of Escheker, or in anye other hys Courtes, that anye Sherife or Sherifes, other then officers accomptant, haue receyued or taken any such fines, issues, or amerciaments, by thys present act pardoned and acquited: that then euery suche Sherif and Sherifes, & other accomptantes shalbe discharged, released, pardoned, and acquited therof, by hys or their othe, without any further triall in that behalfe.

Prouided alway, that thys present act of free pardone, nor anye thing therein conteined, in any wise extend to discharge, remit, or acquite, any persone and persones, for anye suche issues, fines, or amerciamentes, of one hūdred shillinges or vnder, as any Shirife heretofore haue accoūpted, before the Barones of the kynges Excheker, or els where, & payed the same Issues, Fines, and Amerciamentes, vpon hys or their said accoumpte, determined to the kyngs vse, and hath hys or their quietus est for the same.

Prouided alway, and bee it enacted, by the aucthoritie of thys present parlament, that all and euery persone and persones, which haue tended or ought to sue liuery out of the kyngs handes, of any Manours, lādes, tenementes and hereditamentes whatsoeuer they bee, shall sue hys or their liuerie and liueries, out of the kynges handes, of hys or their Manours, landes, tenementes, & hereditamentes: any article, acte or actes, thing or thinges, in thys present acte of generall and free pardone, comprised and specified, to the contrarye notwithstanding.

Prouided alwayes, & bee it enacted by the aucthoritie aforesaide, that it shalbe lefull to all and euery clerke, and other officer of any of the kynges Courtes, to awarde and make writtes of Capias vtlagatum, at the suite of the partie pleintife, to the entente to compel the defendaunt and defendauntes, to make aunswere to the plaintife, at whose suite he was outlawed. And that euery persone now being outlawed, shal sue a writ of Scire facias against the partie or parties, at whose suite he was outlawed before, hys pardone in that behalfe shalbe allowed to hym, that so is outlawed.
